xv_TKCysqrdCEfmvk0kFHg.text: Wow we loved this place! Wanted to try something off the strip and we're glad we did! We sat at the sushi bar and it was such a nice experience. yaM-w7AqtgIdKluVcGQEpg.text: This used to be Doh, one of our favorite places to eat in town. Compared to Doh, They removed a lot of the Korean dishes, but have improved the sushi selection. The price was lowered by $2. We like this place, but we miss Doh. Open late, 2am if I remember right.

1MH4efg0fLjw2q4Gb8twjA.text: Not  Doh sushi anymore! The food was just horrible, Yama rolls were just soaked in starch and oil.

e5LbVx2Urd_ojWz7YR41ng.text: I went in for all you can eat sushi, I made the biggest sushi mistake ever. Not even one sushi chef is Japanese. My expectations were way too high for this place because I was expecting a Japanese food. Wow! Don't go here for sushi. I visit Japan for business and private vacation. I speak fluent and I know the culture well, this place is not Japanese. Very disappointed.

5ZbR5fKBzEFeQf55ZxRvZA.text: Sushi is always a hit or miss for me, and this time it was a hit. Sushi tasted wonderful, but the service was horrendous, which unfortunately is why I'm giving this establishment a 3 star rating. I sat at the bar and didn't get any drink service until I was eating my last roll... No water and I had to ask twice for wasabi and ginger.... Slow waiting staff but excellent sushi.

G2Lw71jNZi_rsbPgu9j2MA.text: Honestly if I could give no stars I would! We had party of 14 and the service was terrible from start to finish. They took 20 minutes to give us our water on top of hour wait when they said it would be a 30-40 minute wait. We only came here because it was our last resort. We wished we just stayed at Goyemon because the wait was just as long. When it was time to have our order taken, the food took forever and they kept forgetting orders. We had to ask other servers and the only guy that was really attentive to our party was the Filipino dude (wishing we got his name because he was the only one serving us) We ordered three times and never got any of those orders we had to keep asking. The last straw for me was when we ordered edamame and the table next to us who was there long after we arrived got their edamame. Seriously, we waited 30 minutes and I had to tell them to cancel the order because at that point we were beyond upset. My sister ordered a white tuna shortly after and she never got that either. The waitress who originally served us paid us no attention after we complained that we never got any of our food.  We saw the sushi makers just standing around.  The quality of the sushi was very mediocre. The sushi rice overpowered the sushi and was too vinegary. Honestly the worst sushi restaurant we've been too! I don't normally review restaurants but the service was so horrible that I had to. And the fact that our party was a big party the tip was included. They honestly didn't deserve 18% Seriously that's how horrible it was.  I would never reckoned this place to anyone and definitely won't be back. Honestly there are so much other sushi places with better sushi and service.

qrH63cAgVTRfyoQW4hNO9w.text: I'd like to start this review off and say that the quality of sushi/food is good, which is the only reason for my 2 star review. However, what really brought my experience down was the lack of customer service this place has. Me and my husband waited 15 minutes before anyone came to our to ask if we wanted to order anything else. The only reason someone actually came to our table was because I had my hand up trying to wave someone down. We had our plates stacked up because we already finished our sushi rolls...and still no one came. No one even came to fill up our waters after seeing our glasses empty. I do not usually complain, but the lack of initiative and urgency the servers had was mediocre. This is unfortunate because I usually loved dining at this location for Doh Sushi, however now that this establishment has replaced it.. I don't think I will be coming back.

BIhdGdXcgbkp5io-9WFD0g.text: Glad they opened a new location and at a much bigger place than the one in Flamingo/Maryland. Love this new place! Good parking space. Great food for AYCE, the price is average! Friendly staff.  There is no waiting time, we got seated right away.  Servers are attentive to our needs. Food ordered arrived at the right time.  I will definitely choose this place for the AYCE sushi restaurant and will recommend to my family and friends.

Qz81NIFG51ZK05h7MUeKwg.text: Always have loved the sun of beach roll! Service could do better but overall the food is consistent. Although they didn't have uni, so they offered lobster in replacement.

mgDKIxtTiCSTnplEtq9R7g.text: This was my first time here and I loved it. Great service and food. We love AYCE sushi and Yama sushi more than exceeded our expectation. My favorite part was the half roll portions that allowed us to try different rolls without waste. Will be back for sure.

H-4D1L7R4kqpHUbiKp6M_w.text: Sushi itself was good. The reason I'm giving a 1 star is because of the . When ordering the uni, it said one order per person on the menu. When our waitress was explaining it us it sounded like one order per person per round. After we finished our first round we put in an order for a second round. Our waitress then disappeared for an hour. So we asked the bus boy if he could check on our order. The manager comes to our table and tells us the one order person is for the entirety of the dinner. I asked how we were able to get multiple orders of other items that were one order per person. He then proceeded to give me the run around. I also told him that we had ordered a round of giant clams and it hasn't come out and we've been waiting for 40 mins since our waitress disappeared. He offered to bring them out but I was so over with my experience there that I told him it was okay we we're already full. Definitely will not repeat.

yzQrv06XnyHRJ2CJnwBpqA.text: Service is great. Mulan and Killer were awesome. So I guess it's really up to how you expect to be treated. This is a AYCE and service like this is much better than a lot of full service restaurants I have been to. Food were great and fresh. Perhaps I am an easy-eater but I have had bad sushi before so I can't complain. So far, this is the best Japanese AYCE I have ever ever ever been to. This place is a must go to whenever I am in town. Keep it up Yama!!!!!!

K0LKmMMowLHAf-phIIPSkQ.text: This a great place and price for All you can eat sushi. If you visit, make sure to ask for Carlos, aka "sexy daddy", he will take care of you and recommend some delicious food. Carlos gave us an amazing service.

fyNvAk36D6jsFvs7txY1PQ.text: Originally before Yama Sushi took over this place used to be Doh Sushi. I haven't been to this Yama Sushi location, but have been to their other location on Maryland and Flamingo plenty of times while going to UNLV. This location is a lot bigger than its other location, but I've heard they expanded.   The service here was great. It seemed like the servers were constantly available as multiple servers floated around taking orders, bringing out the food, and refilling drinks within different table sections. The food was brought to our table not too long after we ordered. There is nothing worse than waiting for the food to come out when you're on your "eating flow."   The All You Can Eat (AYCE) menu seems to be similar from what I can remember at the other location. They also have a separate menu for those doing a la carte, which one of my three friends did. Among the things we ordered some of them were: baked green mussels, takoyaki, different types of nigiri, the Wet Dream Roll (one of my favorites), the Double Dragon Roll, and mochi ice cream. The rice to fish ratio is good to where the rice doesn't take the bulk of the sushi piece.  I wish they had a larger dessert menu. Ice cream and mochi ice cream is what I usually get, but it's nice to have other options just in case I want to try something else. Overall, I'd say it's a good place to go to.

fcwLBxz6iuhjzwXVug3BKw.text: Been to this place twice now and it didn't disappoint; the service was consistent both times. I liked that the staff was present but not overwhelming. The sushi is decent and the AYCE menu has a lot of variety thought the "rules" give me a bit of anxiety lol like I gotta have a chat with my stomach before ordering hahah good place tho

xnRm1gR4sfoYUc7r2SlOpw.text: My Husband and I were in Las Vegas for a car show and we tried Yama Sushi.  It was ok; not the best but not the worst.  I'm more indifferent than anything else. There was some I loved and some I didn't like.   The Scallop Nigiri I had was drenched in vinegar.  It was just so overpowering that you can't taste anything else.  I love vinegar but, when there is way to much to taste anything else it's not to good.  There was one roll we had in my pictures that the plate is swimming in vinegar.  All the other rolls were pretty good.  It wasn't great it wasn't a bad place it's just not my favorite and it wouldn't be my first choice to go there.  They did have all you can eat and they include desert which was different and really nice to be included in the all you can eat.  I would be willing to go back at some point and see if it is any different.  One thing I have to say is they are all about presentation!!!  All the sushi was beautiful!!! When your food looks pretty it defiantly is nice!!!

xmGW_xPzt-aNy_ezzhCsiw.text: i give this visit a 4  (Keep in mind i've eaten at top sushi places in japan. lol)  Customer Service: The waiters/waitresses were really good about continuously checking if we wanted to put in another order and clearing off the plates that we had finished eating.   Food: I like how the chefs did not put on too much rice with the fish. the salmon was pretty good quiality. tasted like the cut came from near the belly. also had ikura, spicy ahi, saba, soft shell crab. lastly the uni portion could've been a little more. i got only half the tongue per nigiri.   Price: for $23 / person AYCE at dinner time, that's actually the best price we have found so far.   Will keep this one on our radar to return.

yMWUN8qa3bkBhkOSwPF85A.text: Me and my boyfriend took a chance to come here on V-Day and surprisingly it wasn't that bad of a wait, 30 mins compared to the hour or longer at their sister location. This was his first time here and was he wow'd. I had take him to Goyemon for his birthday last year and he was impressed but this place just blew him away. The service was very good and attentive. We noticed they all had nicknames so our mission that night was to find out all the different names floating around. All their dishes were on point as far as tastiness and freshness. It kept up to the same level as their primary location if not more, because the staff at this location was a lot more customer service oriented. The only thing I found disappointing was the limit on one type of dessert- you can only get one mochi and one scoop of ice cream rather than two mochi's or two scoops of ice cream. When did that change?  Either than that, everything was FABULOUS!

3ZwgAVtp61Z2nSvy2zXY_g.text: One of the best all you can eat sushi restaurant in Vegas. Nice atmosphere and delicious food! I love their sweet shrimp and seafood salad.

Q3nOVdUJ9br7bg0sEyFErA.text: Horrible experience! Found plastic wraps still on one of our rolls. Asked for a manager and got a supervisor who was not empowered to do anything. 5x8jRBHFRV8A-K9qJu4bbw.text: This place is a place I go to when when everything else isn't open. As soon as we got to the establishment, it took us 7 minutes to get seated.  7 minutes standing with just another couple behind us.   The food here is alright, it's almost like eating the same thing. My favorite thing to order here is the "Wet Dream" and "Hamachi Kama". I used to enjoy going here but as I widened my view of sushi, this place is mediocre. There were bookshelves and it almost seemed as if this restaurant was first deemed to become a cafe of some sort. Just a random observation.  However, the food and service were fair (or maybe less than that)  At the every end, they do offer ice cream and mochi. We got our mochi and it was already melted as well as our ice cream.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

e60f6JCNxQqd_LlAw7gHGw.text: Yama has sensational sushi and equally amazing service. It was incredibly busy for a monday night yet the wait to grab a table for 2 was less than 15 minutes without a reservation. Ordered tons of sushi and with 5 chefs on duty and tons of servers on the floor was out of there full, satisfied, and encouraged to come back in less than an hour.

FXb9Gi6mJ2VYBqCJg2TQjA.text: I don't eat sushi but this place is legit. My co worker and I did the all you can eat lunch. Omg best place ever!   I recommend this place. The only part that was a little annoying they take kind of a bit of time to get the sushi out so if you want sushi order about 2 or 3 worth of sushi and also I ordered egg rolls and fried rice with bbq pork. Delicious!

8R4bTkPfsUyCA_TmmH8ysA.text: For the price of A.Y.C.E., you really can't beat it! I love coming here because rarely do I ever have to wait a long time to get a seat but I love the service I get when we are seated. Wait staff is very attentive and food always comes out rather quickly. I enjoy the variety of rolls and appetizers offered. The quality of fish is good and you truly get your money worth every time you come here.

WbcRIOh5uc3G6syn63UF4Q.text: Was excited to try this place after my friend recommended it. We got there for lunch and were told the wait was 30 minutes so we decided to stick it out. After waiting maybe 25 minutes another group of similar size walks in, walks past the host, and sits down at a table that was most likely being cleared for my group. The management approached the group but ultimately let their slight slide after they were given a cash bribe. I can't speak for this places food but I can speak for their integrity-- I'll take my business elsewhere.

QGbVALlgg6ZEkqQD8TwzVQ.text: I was here in Las Vegas for a 3 day weekend trip. Yama deserves a 3 1/2 stars. This sushi buffet was ok. My friends like it.  I had better else well. I feel like the sushi is cut very thinly or small. There were a lot of rice on the sushi and rolls. I like the poke bowl & the mochi ice cream. And the items that were better, you can only order it one time. Would I come back here again, probably not. However, my friends said they would come back again. $23.99 per person.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi pieces were thinly sliced. A lot of rice on the sushi &amp; rolls. I like the poke bowl.

RaH-tjAnfGy14EAlbxAPfA.text: Probably some of the freshest sushi I've ever had! The service was exceptional and I can't wait to take my family and friends back to this place when we go back to Las Vegas next month!

P0Rl8DNru2S0P-GVyCn_SQ.text: Yama Sushi is this AYCE spot in Chinatown! They always have a massive wait, but it's a good spot if you want cheap sushi fast.   I ordered the tiger roll and spicy edamame as appetizers and they are SPICY! I was not a big fan. Usually the spice meter isn't that spicy on spicy tuna and edamame. Heads up, ask for mild if possible.   I also ordered the yama roll which was the best one on the menu in my opinion. The quality of fish isn't that great, but you do get what you pay for.   The dessert was the best part my opinion. Haha I ordered the strawberry & mango. Also, pistachio nut ice cream.

arx9XG7nCi5k52EA0uFn0w.text: The food was awesome, I was told by a friend who referred me that the service would take some time before actually getting food so I went in with that mentality but it was the complete opposite. My husband and I ordered several rolls along with some rice bowls and they started arriving to the table immediately. I was extremely impressed. However there was a bit of a wait to get in but it's understandable  not a deal breaker at all. All you can eat sushi for dinner $27 ... I'm sold.  I will be back without a doubt

HTYTkDhcbKF-X01m6yQR1A.text: I've been hearing so much hype about this place. It's ok, but way over-hyped. I came for lunch. No bells and whistle, like Toro, Uni, Salmon Belly, and they ran out of sweet shrimp (Amaebi) so I struck out there. The parking stinks in that plaza. Taste was ok, but nothing to write about to you Yelpers.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MIInguuk87BmKXtsNqGH2Q.text: 23$ for all you can eat sushi!!! Wow it was so fun and so yummy. Everything was fast and fresh and delicious. It was a great way to try lots of new kinds of sushi but also get your favorite. Loved the mochi for desert. Can't wait to go back.

_LAnXNI16dYuIx3tiikYkQ.text: The only reason I'm giving this place two stars is because the sushi was actually good everything else was terrible. We waited 10+ minutes for every roll we ordered sometimes even more the only reason a waiter would come to our table was to pick up our empty plates. Our waiter would ask us what we wanted and would leave only to come back and ask what we wanted AGAIN. she did it more than once every time we ordered she would right it down or at least I thought she would. The only time she came to our table quick was when she came to pick up our card.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i1ljknrrZEii8NgqSREHgw.text: This place is definitely not what everyone hypes it out to be. The food is mediocre and the service is horrible. I've never had to wait over an hr anywhere for some shrimp tempura and teriyaki chicken. Not to mention 30-40 minutes for baked rolls. Won't be coming back.

5d4Qy28LhLg4KMqQAS_SjA.text: Love this sushi spot not to busy and caters great for big groups. Although one time we ordered chicken nuggets for our child and never received them kept asking each time the server came back to find out they didn't have it. They did take care of us for their mistake. They are also non sushi friendly and they don't take forever for those options to come out to table.

GIbTu9nPRoUse3b49cdj0Q.text: Amazing place. Great sushi great service very attentive and friendly love the nametags love the name of the sushi. Good location it's all you can eat,  so don't waste the food otherwise you have to pay for it extra. Great ice cream green tea that's fantastic place to be.

QptCOHBpw_cE-SrGAmkVEg.text: Really good Sushi, good service and clean place.  Parking was not so fun, but it's not their fault.

3E9QugjMq66CBzUtqh-lTg.text: We came here with friends after they got married. I was hesitant at first about going to a sushi place. When we got there it was packed. After sitting down for a while and experiencing the food I have to say I was glad we went. The food was great with a very good selection and tasty.  They have Japanese beer as well as hot and cold sake. Definately would come again.

nnlPiU0J-f0unQpJ6Wao8w.text: The sushi's are alright. One of the item on the menu,  which was tasty, was Man Whore. The place is clean and the ambiance is amazing. The staff is really nice. This was my first time in Vegas. I will come back to try the other sushi's.

-7IPOfdPg5O8G_27NDu17w.text: AMAZING!!! Best AYCE in town! This place has so many great thing to brag about. Let's start with the awesome atmosphere and upbeat-fun music selection. The staff is very friendly, and if you can sit in LESTER's section, DO IT! He is the ultimate guide for all things DELICIOUS! He helped point out some menu items we otherwise would of overlooked. We tried several appetizer selections (the Green Mussels are our FAV!!), as well as sushi rolls. Hands down the "Man Whore" & "Special Yobo Roll" are some of the BEST! I could go on and on. We ended with pistachio &  red bean ice cream. I added a mango Mochi ice cream last min. Lester surprised us with this awesome display (see pic). Yama Sushi is definitely worth every penny and will be one of our go-to spots from now on. One more thing...Try the fresh wasabi!!!! (another delicious tip from Lester)

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pistachio &amp; Red Bean ice cream and Mango Mochi. Thanks Lester!

UQXtToCdZiKOOtz0zJZsAQ.text: Love the all you can eat sushi such a reasonable price plus the service is a1 they always bring it out on time and waiters are amazing and ever since I first came I fell in love thanks for great sushi place

TGWxxmWHkCMuIUAYhZ5k1Q.text: This is the best sushi restaurant I've ever been to! You pay $23.95 all you can eat and can choose anything from the menu including soups, salads, and desserts. This is a deal in Vegas. Every staff member we encountered was friendly and politely answered any question we had. The sushi is absolutely amazing. We ordered 8 rolls between the two of us and loved every roll. My personal favorites were the who's your daddy roll and the man whore roll. Definitely recommend for any visitor or local.

RucSP2cjVdw8HsHzrtMzRA.text: In comparison to the original Yama, Yama Sushi 2 (second branch)definitely has the freshest selection between the two. The only down fall to Yama Sushi 2 is the service which is regrettably slow. It may take up to 30 min to receive a half roll and sometimes your order is forgotten. If you find yourselves waiting close to 25-30 mins to get someone to take or return your check then I would recommended standing up, I've seen this from other (albeit more frustrated) patrons, and gently flag someone down. Still, the food is amazing and the servers try their best to get your order taken and delivered. Management needs to work something out on the lines of customer to server ratio.

ycNgiAy0YB3Jt3bxyTw7cQ.text: The food here is so great. The staff is extremely good hearted. Affordable. Sushi portions and sizes are perfect. Good order turn around time. Only recommendation is the front of house needs a full time host. Honey bunny is fantastic but she's definitely busy! Venelope is a GREAT waitress and person. Will definitely be coming here a lot more.

p1lzkVAorgdIvEs5WkvvqA.text: Love this place! I like the location on Flamingo a little better, but usually go to this one since it's closer to me. They have a full menu (double sided) and do have a la carte items. My family and I usually do the all you can eat menu option. It's waaaaay worth it because we order an appetizer, salad, various rolls, then ice cream. So far during all my visits all the servers are friendly, good customer service. Really busy around dinner time, but what great food place isn't? Definitely recommend the soft shell crab and Dragon roll!

FJ9wpet-7GuQckTnEN9AAQ.text: This area is one of the hardest to get parking but it's worth it. Me and my friends came here on a Saturday night to grab some food before a movie. Me and another Nicole came in and put our name down while we waited for our other friends to show up and find parking.. It took them forever but I understand why!! It's so hard! We got seated and while waiting for them got a drink order in and they finally came in. We got to look at the menu for a while and the the waitress came over and took our order. I wasn't really the hungry so I only got one dragon roll and one of my other friends doesn't really care for sushi so she just got some fried rice. My other two friends got the all you can eat menu which also can include fries, fried rice and some other random things. It cost an extra dollar per roll for soy paper. But I really love it when places are okay when not all the table is all you can eat. I know people probably think they are going to share the food or something but it doesn't always work out that way. We got our food really fast and it was delicious. They have all kinds of unique rolls. One of the ones I remember was the Harry Potter roll. It didn't have much to do with Mr. Potter but it was a unique name. Before finished we ordered mochi and ice cream which was the perfect ending to out meal. I ordered green tea ice cream and strawberry mochi and they only charged me for one. It was really nice of them.

aTdW8PgXI2hlJ-JVbI5J_w.text: Yama Sushi is great. Good food, great atmosphere, and the drinks are good. Will definitely be back for more.

4MDtoUojufWDpxNWjZo9lw.text: This place isn't too bad. it's really cute inside and I was seated fairly quickly. The sushi was actually really good and the service was pretty much great until one of the waitresses was being weird and rude to my friend and I. As my friend is ordering rolls she cuts him off and says "NO", then after we order our dessert the same waitress says "you guys are fat asses haha" ummm wat. I feel like that's very rude to say to any customer and definitely made us both feel extremely uncomfortable. Don't know what her deal was but ok anyways good service and good sushi, just watch out for that rude waitress lolz.

rOaCzpt3atdnJvgXScmYSQ.text: Best all you can eat sushi place I've ever been to (not only Las Vegas but all over). Sweet Shrimp, No Name roll, Sun of the Beach roll, and Trust Me Baby roll were particular favorites. Awesome service with 6-7 different waiters and waitresses constantly asking if we wanted to put more food orders in. Tab would have easily exceeded $140 for two of us anywhere else but ended up under $60.   Definitely worth the Uber from the strip or if you find yourself in Chinatown

B0FYrPvIBGB2YSySpJ1zsA.text: The food was amazing , the service was horrible !! I came in last night with my friend , waited about 10-15 mins to get a drink, placed our order,my friend got hers within 5 mins , 15-20 mins I get mine which was one tray of 4 Lil shrimps , I'm guessing my order was forgotten , then we placed another order which never came out , meanwhile 2-3 other waitress took our order and it was confusing because we don't know if the one before put it in or not because we kept getting a new waiter asking "did someone help you" we said"yes" , but learned down the line we wouldn't receive it , I don't know if because they were closing in an hour they wanted to get everything else done like cleaning, closing down , then in the middle of eating they place the check down yet we weren't even done eating,everyone else around us seem to be getting excellent service but us, very offended, yet still tipped for horrible service but because the food was delicious .

mlDbv5YU_eFD_7xAw_gInw.text: Yamasushi has yet to let me down.  Always good sushi and great service. They have a wide variety of dishes including my all time favorites: SWEET SHRIMP WITH HEAD* UNI* IKURA WITH QUAIL EGGS  These items* are usually a dinner only option, but here, they serve it at lunch too!   I will definitely come back to this location!

dgphnUudJy0tnO_O3-Uvfg.text: Yama sushi is one of my favorites!! Of course we always have the AYCE menu... I love that they have soft shell crab on the menu - they also have "sexy salmon" or "sexy tuna" or "sexy" any kind of nigiri - I always get the "sexy yellowtail" and the "sexy tuna" - order half rolls too , they're always great and not overwhelming so you can have more variety throughout- try #24 - #25 #7 just to name a few!

gwOi8h_ykLc_5w3zyFHq6Q.text: I went for a late dinner last night for the AYCE. The hostess was great. She greeted promptly and sat us quickly. The waiters and waitresses are another story. We had to order our drinks 3 different times before they brought it out. We ordered our first round of sushi and after that we didn't see the waiter for atkeast 20mins. I kept trying to flag him down so that we can order and he kept ignoring me and continued to help everyone around us. Finally I had to ask another waitress to take our order.   The food was mediocre. The mussels were over cooked and the nigiri did not taste fresh at all. The only good I can say is the price is really good.  once I asked another waitress to assist us we were no longer waiting so long. I am a stickler for customer service.

-oXu15gaabi5NhHZ9Cvn4g.text: Yummy food, AWESOME SERVICE! They kept making sure we had refills and cleared the table considerably and consistently. All you can eat offers half orders of the rolls so you can try more variety. Happy to tip the waiters, chefs and staff for a stellar experience

8--aEo3SvEhDa4lb8khq8Q.text: Meh! Decided to check out this new location to see if it's any good.   First impression sucked w the staff. A friend had gotten a table first and my bf and I came in a couple minutes later. Waitress asked if we were ready and I said not yet. She said she'd be back but never came back. Had to try and flag someone down after 20minutes. It's like we were invisible in the area they sat us at which is once you enter the restaurant, all the way to the right in the corner. I'm not sure how many times I've waved my hand and the waitress just doesn't pass our table or just doesn't look over.   Food was not that great. Rice had a strong vinegar taste to it, I think they went vinegar happy or something. The amount of rice in a hand roll was just absolutely ridiculous. There was so much rice, the roll became unenjoyable. We literally ate just the section w the fish/veggies along w some rice and there was still a good chunk of it left. The miso soup was sooooo salty.   A few of our orders never made it to the table even though we mentioned it 2-3 times.   All in all, will never come back here. It's lame. Crap service and food.

LiQmzbHBL3adc9AUAaY4RQ.text: Overall, I really enjoy coming to this restaurant for all you can eat sushi. I've been here about three times now and the staff is always very friendly and attentive. This place is more spacious than most sushi places which is great when you have large parties or eating with the family. Our orders came out fast and very well prepared. Plus the price is great for all you can eat! The only thing I would warn is that the plaza can get busy during peak hours and parking a nightmare, so plan ahead.

6c7oTXGUC1Vwh3fNo-vV0A.text: This location is literally my favorite. Even though it isnt as good as the original Yama, so worth coming here. There is less waiting time and the ambiance is so much nicer and less crowded.   This is literally my favorite sushi place in all of las vegas. All the fish is super fresh and all the rolls are super delicious. The staff are super friendly and attentive. You never have to ask them to refill your drinks or pick up your dishes. THEY ARE ON TOP OF THEIR GAME!!! Snow in Vegas and No Name are some of my most favorite rolls on the menu.  I will forever be loyal to Yama sushi. I've tried others and I've been super let down as they don't compare.

3JKxYV-3-vQDciFXPYis9g.text: A friend and I were checking out Chinatown and pulled in to a parking lot.  We drove around looking for a place for lunch.  We saw Thai, Chinese, Vietnamese, and Japanese.  We decided to walk in to Yama Sushi not knowing what's behind those glass doors.  We were greeted warmly and seated right away.  This was around 1:30pm and there were still a lot of people eating.  The place was not too noisy and clean.  Not much of a sushi person, we each ordered a bento box.  For less than $9.00, we got miso soup, salad, rice with salmon and Korean bbq.  They were outstanding and fresh.  We also ordered spider roll for appetizer and it was so delish.  Service was excellent.  Waitresses checked on us often and hot tea was poured consistently.  The ambiance was great and we will definitely come back and try AYCE next time.  We will definitely bring out-of-town guests to this place.  Very presentable place.

mhyl1WNJqj9mtnEtUkzr7A.text: All I can say is this place really sucks I waited for almost 20 min for a waiter to come and take my order mind i actually had to tell the busser to get me a waiter . Menu here is not the greatest . Selection is very small here I fell like I was invisible here o well never coming here again

w0givttIwVtsIw-cPc8fSQ.text: This is place is so delicious and yummy their sushi is soooo fresh ! The customer service is amazing the employees and manager are so kind and sweet !!! I recommend this place for everyonnnneeee !!! I love this place

idqyEeE0di0h5dcIRQZmcg.text: Nice place and good environment, with excellent service. Most definitely see myself coming back

BVsbgFV_MU_DlHdN16fyUg.text: Never coming back! My Fiance and I did not have a good experience. Our hot food orders came out cold and we waited 20min for two orders to come out. When we asked about them we keep getting from multiple people it's coming, to only find out the order was never put in. People here are rude and the food was very bland. Try at your own risk!!!!!!

Hy7yaVBp1knoZnbcUb0bqQ.text: Super friendly and patient staff.  The fish was fresh and they have gluten free soy sauce (Tamari) for those in your party who may be gluten free.

rKqyC0WAZQ3IjtyghBCTVQ.text: All you can sushi? Not really all you can eat I guess.  Waitress took our order of uni but the lady didn't come back to inform us we won't be getting it. Wasted thirty minutes in a 2hr minimum all you can eat sushi...

KBKqf7p5FmhxYrHADZHgYg.text: Great food and the staff is friendly and care about the customers. We were checked on by 3-4 diff waiters other than ours

m7RzoS3otBVqOjXSKN1Klg.text: 3.5/5 stars for the exceptional service we got but with a few disappointments with the food. We came in on a Saturday at 6:30pm and our party of 4 was seated within 10-15 min which was great! As soon as we sat down our server came and got our orders since we already knew what we wanted. It was funny because the whole time we felt that we had 5+ servers for our table since they all kept stopping by our table making sure we were alright, taking our orders, dropping off the food, refilling our drinks constantly etc! The food came out super quick as well which was a huge plus considering our AYCE sushi experiences have us waiting years for our food to come out!   Overall, the food was just ok. The miso soup was very salty which made it hard for me to eat. Their dessert selection wasn't very appealing for they only had ice cream and mochi. I was really looking forward to some tempura type of dessert but sadly that wasn't on the menu. Rolls that were great were the "Harry Potter" and "No Name" so I'd give those a try! Also, for pricing it's $23.95 for AYCE dinner from 3pm-2:30am.

v2dCItgHLnm8D-pCE-_YuA.text: Best sushi in Vegas in my opinion, Enjoyed the new second location.  It's as good as the first.  Also enjoyed finding out you can order half rolls so you can try different rolls all for a great price.  They were quick and very friendly.

dWQ3SLKRUch2HUQBFuw7IA.text: Really great food fast service. The all you can eat has a wide variety of options it's totally worth the price. It also includes dessert. I got the crazy roll it was amazing. The tempura udon soup is really good too.

3Mt-NOUulkl8XQ9w5amq3w.text: The wait for ordering food is so long and they also forget your food. The customer service is just terrible. Save your money and go somewhere else.

hTlwMK2tR_vGw54OLn2XSQ.text: We recently visited Las Vegas and boy was this one of my favorite place for sushi it's amazing wish they had one in Los Angeles.

h1ZThvDhD7R_igmyVAR7Lw.text: The best all you can eat sushi in town. They have a huge selection of specialty rolls and their hamachi Kama is so good. My favorite sushi roll is the wet dream. You got to try it.

RlmucJhuO_mjFAe2WGz3Hg.text: The staff was incredibly slow and did everything at THEIR own leisure. We waited about 15 minutes in between each roll because no one came by to take our order. We sat and waited another 20 minutes just for our change despite the fact that the restaurant was near empty and we saw multiple times the staff just hanging around talking to each other. Their prices seem reasonable until they add on 15% tip (which they require you to pay or you cannot leave even though the service was nowhere near good enough to warrant even a 5% tip). This would be understandable for a larger party as gratuity but we were a party of 4. Overall, with unfriendly staff and ridiculously slow service, I cannot recommend this restarting to anyone who wants a pleasant dining experience.

baFk2iXOewRW-HXDwdbaQA.text: Came here around 1 am because I heard it was great.  Had to do to go because I was so exhausted and didn't have the energy to dine in.  I am still sitting here as I'm writing this yelp review.  Pretty sure they forgot about 3 rolls and edamame.  No one to assist in the front so I had to walk inside to find out what was going on.  The waitress was at her station and when I flagged someone down to ask what is taking so long.  PS I work 2 doors down from you guys so mind you I was being extremely patient.  When the server finally saw me she made the basic "Oh shit" face!  Here's the kicker I asked right next to your sushi chef and when I informed them it's going on 30 minutes for a to go order they laughed.  Such poor service!!!!!!  Good luck with the staff you have!

0Pt6-0tEvdUnKQLRRyh0BA.text: I love coming here for a late night sushi date with my friends. They have an amazing selection to choose from. The scenery is great and the customer service to match!

LrTi4-nrQX_6I_DSv9xzAA.text: Great sushi and all you can eat! As of this writing it is $20.95 for lunch, $23.95 for dinner. Great Rolls, great quality. Amazing service, open till 2:30am. Dim sum apps included, as well as Kochi for dessert. Love it. This place rocks!

jdYX5ESrT27AwSXE36UNsw.text: Nice atmosphere came in while in the area for late lunch, menu has good variety and the fish is fresh I have to say it's amazing that they are open 7 days a week til 2:30am I will keep this on my radar for late night dinners

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very good selection on rolls they offer half rolls and hand rolls on some of their menu which is awesome ! Food is fast to the table

c-4fv5AFkv5FRVTC9Vogrg.text: You guys! This spot has the best sushi I've tasted thus far in this town!!!!!! The appetizers are amazing and they have plenty of rolls that do not contain raw fish! I love that!!! Service is fast although being seated may take a while. Parking takes a while as well so plan for that. Food is made fresh and the interior decor is cool and out of this world. There's a huge screen which I like that displays pictures. Liking is pleasant and appealing as well. Now, the bathroom is dirty and definitely need a cleaning! Other than that, this trendy sushi spot is the bees knees!

bfNjC6oqggqQluQRyflaiw.text: Great sushi place, enjoyed rolls specially speciality rolls like Volcano and Spicy tuna, can get little crowded during peak times. Staff friendly but super busy and  kinda rush you for ordering, decently clean!

vGVJn1SrJB0bhHGWLPIvzg.text: Quick service, fairly priced AYCE. Chefs drink, which is a plus. Most importantly, they did not put too much rice on their rolls and nigiri. 10/10 would bang.

fsGijr4B67Q2zZ05_dhY9g.text: Pros: Food, location  Cons: Service at times, busy  Details: One of the better AYCE places in Vegas. The location is also great. They have another location on Flamingo. The sushi is always top notch. So many awesome rolls and a good deal. The service can be great but it can also be so-so. Kind of the nature of sushi places I have found where sometimes items are missed or the staff has to be asked a couple times. Still, I highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tfvyd5F5zw3OKq9X7VCMAw.text: Food quality is very inconsistent, but most of the time it's not good. The menu and taste even varies from their own local locations... don't waste your money.

i8eEl6NbcUNR12DBrnZ3Cw.text: I was with a group of five and normally would steer clear of a sushi place that has a three star rating on Yelp. Everyone wanted sushi, there was a line at the door and the restaurant smelled great.  So glad we found this gem. Two of us got the unlimited sushi. $23.95 and you can pick anything off the menu. You can also choose to get half rolls so that you can try more without wasting food. You can also pick from the appetizer and/or dessert menu.    So..so...so GOOD. Fresh fish, delicious sauce and incredibly patient and friendly staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sashimi
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bento box
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crunchy friend roll

dipz-rhS2VI-jCk_A4AE4w.text: Not recommended, sticky table and kitchen menus are normally overcooked. The lowest rate that I can give among AYCE sushi in the valley,

Q3UIMujr_IYiOiXR12Zt2A.text: Of all the AYCE sushi joints in Vegas, this is my favorite. I usually get good service (yes, I said Usually, because sometimes they suck) but the rolls, nigiri and appetizers are always on point. My favorite, which I always order half of, is the No Name and the Ellen...and they both happen to be soy wrapped! Not exactly what I usually eat, but it blends in really well with the two rolls and makes it seem lighter than the other ones with seaweed and sauce all over.   You can also order a la carte if you can't do AYCE.   Tip: Get there early on the weekends or go at off hours. There's usually a long wait.

IBxvoXYXY6ZFfzS3KOk2fQ.text: I've been coming to this AMAZING sushi  restaurant for about 7 years ! They have the BEST customer service, the BEST sushi and the best ALL YOU CAN EAT PRICES !! $20.00 for lunch and $23.00 for dinner !!!  I first started going to the Flamingo location but I LOVE how open the Spring Mountain location is. It's not as small and tight as flamingo . Although the food is amamzing at EVERY LOCATION !!!! I have brought over 30 people over the course of 7 years and NOT ONE COMPLAINT !! Thank you so much Yama sushi !! I'll see you tomorrow (literally)

wGKAW9zJbBfmUQG7sU04lg.text: Great sushi, great pricing and service love it definitely will  come back and highly recommend

Gvgqx0UQaz2SUpP2uRITuQ.text: My girl and I have been going to the Flamingo location for the past few years but since this one was closer we decided to try it out.. boy we were in for a surprise.  1. Right from the start we asked the host if we could sit by the sushi bar she said "No, but I can offer you a table or booth" it wasnt even busy and no one was sitting there but we choose a booth  2. We found the waitresses over the top annoying. We were not able to have a nice convo or were even done with some of the dishes when they were already asking what else we wanted in a very stalkerish and pushy way. It's like the were rushing us to leave [no I'm not exaggerating] my girl felt super uncomfortable  3. Personally I can put up with almost anything just as long the food is delicious but it was clear to see the quality of food here wasnt great at all. It was ok at best tbh compared to the other location. Most rolls were dry and seem like pre made or old  4. Overall: we really regret going to that location and will not be going back. The experience was so bad we couldn't believe we had to pay for it. Do yourself a favor and just head to the Flamingo location  Hopefully this helps.

rTKpL8rzj3pLNAidQdI07w.text: Yama Sushi is an AYCE sushi restaurant, though you can also order a la carte...But by the time you order a couple of dishes from menu you may find out you are better with the AYCE pricing: $20.95 for lunch and $23.95 for dinner. The set price seems to be the way to go here.   Located in the very heart of Spring Mountain, Yama brings in a lot of foot traffic, so it can be quite busy here. For the record, it is not my typical choice for sushi, but it was already chosen by a good friend of mine.  The inside of Yama is very clean, even the air was absent of any fishy odor, which is often the signal for me to leave, without looking back...but on this day, you guessed it, I stayed.  While my guest ordered many different rolls and enjoyed them very much, I ordered Nigiri Sushi. I am not a fan of rolls in general, especially those drizzled with sauce, so I have nothing to say about the rolls here, I simply avoided them. As is often the case, some items are restricted to only one order per person, such as Uni, Sweet Shrimp, Giant Clam, etc.  A typical issue with AYCE Sushi restaurants is that they want you to fill up fast...they put too much rice on their rolls and Nigiri...not at Yama Sushi. Perfect amount for each bite!!   The service was attentive and friendly. They don't rush you, but they are not slow to take your order either.  So, if you need a spot for AYCE and want the option of rolls, nigiri, and sashimi, this might not be a bad option for you.  - 2017 Review #62 -

Even though the food is good, I'd give 5 stars for staff alone! (I'd give more if I could as they are awesome!) Bedman is a superior stand out! XOXO!

FewOCExMdYeNYiGJzD-6kA.text: OMG all you can eat sushi. Being from the Monterey Bay area we don't have an all you can eat sushi place. So that is the 1st plus. 2nd you can order what you want off their menu where as other places you have to pick from what is already made. 3rd drive is fast and I mean fast. The wait was only 5 mins to sit. We sat the waitress was their with in a min. Asked us about drinks and took out order. Maybe 2 mins later our drinks came and maybe another 2 mins the sushi showed up. As soon as the plate it empty someone is asking if you want more and takes the order. And a few minutes last it shows up. They work great as a team there so you don't have to wait for your original waiter. Anyone walking by and sees the empty plate will take it and ask if you want more. Best sushi place I have ever been too. And it all tastes so fresh. My wife made the comment that she could taste how fresh her cucumber was. I was impressed by the slices a fish they use not low quality it almost like it melts in your mouth. We are only here 4 days but will be back before we leave.

9OT6TgvUall4hTtV60JHXw.text: I went here for dinner before a school dance. I made no reservations but seats were available within 3 minutes of my arrival. I was even able to get the nice seats at a booth. The sushi was good. The nigiri tasted nice and fresh. The baked rolls were delicious and warm. The rolls with salmon were particularly my favorite. I did the AYCE and it was very much worth the price. It was very fulfilling with the good variety of sushi. For desert, I was able to choose a scoop of ice cream, and one mochi ice cream, among other deserts. All were cold and refreshing. The plum wine ice cream was very good and tasted similar to cotton candy. The mochi was great too. The waiters were kind and almost always ready to take empty dishes away. On this particular day, however, the restaurant was not busy very much. Overall, a very nice and delicious dining experience.

6FPqnzMbshP4snd5vTB94Q.text: Me and my friends came there on a Sunday night around 9pm. Surprisingly it wasn't crowded. It was my first time going there, our waitress was very lovely and attentive!! Forgot to ask for her name  but she has a high ponytail curled. We ordered a lot of good food!!! And the one thing that amazed me most was their uni ( sea urchin ). It was sooooo tasty, sweet and buttery. Best uni I've ever had!! I tried uni over Oyshi and it was not good. I'll be coming back tomorrow with my friend for that uni! I would've given them 5 stars but the nigiri they made was a little sloppy, broken fishes, but it came out really fast though. I ordered some unagi and it has too much fat, the cut was uneven also. But overall, the quality is good, service is awesome!

I know it's China Town and it usually always busy but dang.  Once we entered I was pleased to find that waiting area was so spacious compared to the original location. The original has a bench inside that seats maybe 5 people and some benches outside. Anyways very pleased with the waiting area. As I walked in I was also pleased to find how big and spacious the entire restaurant was. I'm used to being elbow to elbow. Here however was very roomy. I was also so so happy to see booths.  The waiters were very nice and prompt as always. And the food was great. Which I was hoping it would be. And so it was. I just wish that they had like a sushi bar in the middle of the room since they have room to do that.  This location overall is pretty great but again the parking sucks balls! I'd come back with friends. But maybe carpool.

The sushi proportion is perfect, 75% sushi and 25% rice that's how it should be done. The salmon felt like butter, it melts in your mouth so perfectly. I recommend getting the yellowtail Kama, it comes with lemon and ponzu sauce it's so good (although it's limited to 1 per person), their Amaebi (sweet shrimp) is bomb too, you get the option of rather or not you want the shrimp's head which is battered and deep fried. Love coming here, one of my favorite sushi places.

EbG67bxX_BoY1MFare1Jpg.text: My first time trying Yama was for a work outing. We were a really large group so I'm guessing that's why the service was a a little slow. I let the waitress know that I'm allergic to seafood EXCEPT shellfish and if she could recommend me a dish that was applicable for me to eat. She recommended a crab roll so I ordered it and when it came to our table it had raw fish on top. But hey, it did have crab meat inside, so....  I felt a bit uncomfortable since now I needed to be careful about what I order and can't trust the waitress. Other than that, after spending about 10 minutes looking at the lengthy menu, I order the correct items and were brought to me very fresh and savory.   Would I give this place another shot? Absolutely. The waitress may have just been overwhelmed. But I will definetly be looking at the yelp reviews before going in to have a better idea of what their most popular savory dishes are.

W__46kfaH-HZv6VXNXvVUw.text: Some what similar menu, different (bigger) location.  For starters, why wasn't a new Yelp page made for the new location? DOH wasn't that great but why confuse people and not differentiate the two? Have Yama really earn their reviews and stars instead of reflecting off of DOH or mixing the two! The place still felt like DOH, but with Yama menu, I'm sure they're still working on it.  The waiters/waitresses were attentive and friendly but I didn't like how it seemed like they were yelling every time someone walked in. Maybe tone it down to a 5, since everyone working has to greet anyways, lol.  Now about the food.. My all time favorite (and would probably crave here and there) is the "Wet Dream" roll! Baked, cream cheesy, shrimpy goodness! Then maybe "No Name", then "Sun of the Beach".  Their nigiris looked good, not too much rice and fish looked fresh, but I am more of a roll type of person! They also have a good amount of appetizers or sides to choose from.  I haven't been to Yama sushi in years, but after dining here recently I'm not too crazy about it.. I just honestly wasn't impressed.  \_()_/

BTU1NUYqv8ivZh-ITtvB2g.text: This place is awesome for sushi lovers! Don't waste your money on the strip, this is a hit spot for delicious sushi. They have all you can eat sushi and I love that they have small icons next to the favorite ones the spicy ones, they also translate it well so you know what you will be ordering. I like that they make you aware to order only what you will eat or you will pay extra. The portions are small so you get to try it out and if you want more you order more instead of wasting it. They do offer bigger portions. But it's best to order a variety with smaller portions so you don't . waste food. They also let you pick desserts like green tea mochi or ice cream. The mochis are really yummy. Everything is fresh and tasty. It has a good atmosphere. And yes it's busy. And yes the parking lot deal is a mess but I don't mind, it's definitely worth it. The service is good. The food is great. And the price is fair for the quality.

FicS51adjBv9SwEk_sPfEw.text: Looking for DOH in Spring Mountain, drove back & forth looking for it, confused to not find it on yelp/maps anymore... Come to find out it was bought out by YAMA 3 weeks ago! Well, no wonder we couldn't find it. -____- But we came for sushi and we were already there, so we decided to try it out. Same decor & layout as Doh previously had it, just different menu...  We ordered: ROLLS: - No name roll x 2 - Wet dream  - Turning Japanese  - Yama crunch  - Eel nigiri x3 - Salmon nigiri x2 APPETIZERS: - Baked green mussels x2 (4 pieces each order) - Soft shell crab x2 - Dynamite - Miso soup - Edamame  DESSERT: - Green tea mochi - Strawberry mochi   Wasn't too impressed with the menu selection, but did like that each specialty roll on the menu had a little picture so you had an idea of what you are getting. Also, dinner is also only $23.95 (most AYCE sushi places are around $27)! Service was very attentive, but we did have 3 different people checking up on us -- so we often had to say, "Oh, we already told the other server." Made it a tad confusing at times. But overall, a decent dining experience... just nothing I would go out of my way for.  PRO TIP: Order half rolls so you can try different ones out. That way you get 4 pieces versus 8 if you end up not liking it. And if you do like it, you can always order more!

ZdXP86EbUAPJtnP3XBFXPg.text: Decent meal for this price! About 55 for 2 pax before taxes and tips. Side dishes like the Saba fish, sweet shrimp, seafood salad (with lots of salmon sashimi) are recommended!! Service crew was attentive and kept checking back on us for additional orders and cleared the empty dishes promptly as well. Second trip back and it's still awesome!!!

8_7LReRQgUhJQeECHxG7sQ.text: We waited 45 mins and no one took our order. There were 2 servers chit chatting because their conversation seem to be more important :) (walked out after 50 mins)

GUGvTj2negTAOXCK8atkQA.text: Soooooo happy it's open closer to us now! Went last Friday night and we will be back this Friday. Yum! Yum! Yum!! Tip- the "seafood salad" is awesome!

kYgRbHDnTODRQ6P2gSXMkQ.text: This is better than the original Yama! Not a long wait and very spacious. Food was amazing!

qY5Mn3Cw6pkUYc4hRGSxuA.text: It's unfortunate this place is no longer Doh. We were seated by the hostess. Someone can and promptly took our drink order. That was it. No one came after that. We sat for 20min with out a server checking in with us, besides the busser. We couldn't even make eye contact with anyone as they just came and went and walked away. At one point a girl came looking for a table that had ordered Unagi. I told her it wasn't us, because we haven't ordered yet as no one has come since we sat. Instead of apologizing for poor service or showing any concern she just slowly said "ookay" rolls her eyes and walks away looking for the table. From where we sat I could clearly see 2 other tables looking around waiting to be helped. One guy in the booth waved to the hostess as she walked by, instead she helped the busser adjust and prepare another table for guest!? How? If you can't serve the people you have now why would you seat more? The guy in the booth. Behind us continued to be ignored. We got up and walked out, and the hostess "thanked us" for coming.   This was our first time here. Whatever the reason for poor service, it's a shame they showed lack of concern for the people who fund their business.

gNV09kl1C7T06U2-nK47Mg.text: great food , excellent chefs , but service is little bit lousy . i highly recommend this sushi place for excellent rolls andsashimi as well

lJzTK5JC_Qxaw9kAc2l0GQ.text: I've been a regular at doh for months now and after it's been changed to Yama sushi there are quite a few disappointments. First is the services. I don't know if it's the servers fault or the chefs, but a lot of times I never get what I ordered. Dishes are missing and I have to reorder again and again. Next is the rice, it is soggy and crumbling when you pick it up. One last thing is whenever my family gets seated, the seat is always dirty! There's crumbs of food and that irritates me so much.  But other than that , it's okay.

HHB2bdxYPat_EizQQWvgjw.text: Stumbled onto this place. Great selection and very fresh. Screaming deal for all you can eat with everything they offer. Will definitely come back.

L542wK_rRnQ3LfOiBWhbdg.text: The nigiri was great. The food was overall good but the service is what killed it for me. Took 15 minutes for our server to take our order. Multiple times, other servers passed us but we're never acknowledged. Good place but I won't be recommending it.

h7PcvNw6bWTfueb7y_T-ow.text: Had 2 rounds of AYCE sushi and then staff completely ignored the party. Had to ask the receptionist for the check and even then got ignored and attitude.

C2KdO9i1uYQHWDkdH9FUCw.text: We went for the all u can eat sushi dinner. It was good, some stuff was more spicy that advertised but very tasty. The service was good, waitresses constantly checked to see if you need anything else or how things are going. They allow you to order half rolls and dessert is included, great pistachio ice cream.

KBAyGV4xuFNVu5nfgt1WiA.text: Best sushi in town hands down! Everything is so fresh. The service was tremendous! Make sure you look for Leslie and request her as your server. Definitely less wait time than the one on flamingo because it's bigger!

Pcq7w7-jzCW-Fj8X9Us0OA.text: Agree with most other reviewers that the sushi isnt amazing. Employees were very friendly, but service was slow. It is cheaper than most places at $20.95 for AYCE lunch and menu does have a lot to choose from. They forgot some of our orders. Idk how when it was not that busy during friday at 1pm. Also I dont know what happened, but this place used to be called Do'h. Its now called Yama which lm assuming is like the one near UNLV, but nowhere as good. Although employees were super nice, I recommend taking a pass at this place. Theres lots of other sushi places nearby in chinatown with much fresher fish.

yngSSDVx_aAwKfUQoyQ3aQ.text: Wasn't that great. Never coming back here. Service was bad. The guy in the blue shirt was rude. Waited for our check for 30 minutes.

Don't leave food because the waiter will remind you about wasting rice etc.$$.

y6QlDJd6TNmZoVC0Ocd1-A.text: We were on vacay and a local brought us to experience this restaurant. It is all you can eat, or you can just order off the menu. Unfortunately, I wasn't feeling the best so I just ordered a few rolls. The spicy tuna and philly rolls did not disappoint. I was called "basic" for ordering those. Oh well, I probably am!  Others at our table did get the AYCE. There is a 2 hour time limit. You pay for what you do not eat. You cannot just eat the goodies and leave the rice (like for real someone did that) it's 23.95$ which I personally think is a deal. The servers were nice and attentive, the place was packed. Don't be scared about the fact it's in a strip mall! Looks can be deceiving

zK8fb7erhcycbGQhPGNiXg.text: I've been here several times over the past 6 months, it is time for a review.  Yama never fails to deliver.  The rolls are great, the servers are attentive and it seems like the rolls are instantly ready as soon as you order them.  This place can get very busy at times, but it is very much worth the wait.  The No Name Roll was among my favorites.  The Ellen Roll was great as well.  So many servers stopped by to refresh beverages and to take orders. It is a great experience any time I'm here.    I will definitely be back.  If you're on the West Side of town, you should definitely try this place some day.  If you do, you'll be back as well!

LizA9NmZnLZAARETI9g1Jg.text: Came here tonight for AYCE with my boyfriend and parents for an early Mother's Day outing. The service was nothing less than amazing! None of our orders were missed, our empty plates didn't sit on our tables longer than 5 minutes, orders were taken just in time and all of our orders came out within 5-8 minutes after we ordered.   They had a full house with a line out the door and for them to be consistent and fast was amazing considering how packed the place was! Also everything we ordered was so delicious! Definitely have to order the No Name roll and the agedashi tofu :)  I will definitely be returning in the future with more friends :)

FfL4SsG6bZOTOVS01dOH6g.text: Reminds me of the original Yama Sushi location on Flamingo before it went downhill. My wife and I decided to try this place out after promising not to go back to the Flamingo location. Our last visit at the Flamingo location was super unpleasant and the quality of the food was horrible. Seems like this location still has great sushi chefs that care about their work. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. Parking can be a pain since it's located at one of the busiest strip malls in China Town but I think it's worth it. I'd recommend this place to anyone craving sushi in the area.

oIoRiu_KkhyTguZk69qnvw.text: Took the wife here Saturday night and it was excellent. Started with steamed gyoza, BBQ ribs and bacon wrapped shrimp which were all good the ribs were my least favorite. Next we moved onto the rolls No Name, Happy Ending, Wet Dream, Sun of the beach, and Baby one more time all excellent. I like Salmon so the Happy ending is my favorite. Also most of the rolls you can order as half rolls so you can just try them out. Finished with Nigiri we got Salmon, Eel, Shrimp, Yellow tail and Red Snapper. Service was good for how busy they were.  This place is my go to for AYCE Sushi in Vegas and dinner price was 26$ each we had waters to drink.

gsRZX-g4AiOsUivGLSEHtw.text: The first thing I noticed was the decor, feels up scale and intimate. The staff was amazing, very friendly and timely. The food was fresh and delicious. Came for a friends birthday party and even with the large group the waiter was attentive to each of us. Aaron was our waiter, great guy all around. I'll definitely visit this establishment in the near future.

rTa8XCAs7RtQDms0P246Ew.text: Like with any AYCE sushi place, you get your money's worth here just bc of all the options available. But I judge a sushi place based on their nigiri, and I'm sad to say I was disappointed here. The sashimi pieces were rather dry and the rice was lacking in flavor, like not enough rice vinegar. Their menu for nigiri was rather small, not as much variety that I'm used to, and missing some standards in my opinion. But they have a large variety of cooked rolls. The rolls, however, were really delicious and kind of what saved this place for me, 3 stars instead of 2. Their baked and deep fried rolls all sound amazing on the menu, and the flavor doesn't disappoint. But again, if I don't like the nigiri, I feel like I wasted my time. I don't really eat rolls at all, but I felt the need to try them here to really get the value for what I paid ($23.90 AYCE dinner).   The service was great, orders were taken and delivered promptly. All of the servers were really nice and attentive, and I thought it was cute how all their name tags are cartoon characters.   If you like COOKED "sushi," then definitely give this place a try. But if you're like me and prefer the nigiri and real raw stuff, you'd do better to look elsewhere.

I've had a couple chefs from there that were over the top great but my last experience was just not good at all. Me and my boyfriend was there for a good 40 minutes and got 3 and a half rolls... they forgot one of our rolls and I asked for a full roll when he kept saying "half?? Okay". They avoided eye contact with us and the other sushi chef had to take our order even when we weren't assigned to him.   We called to speak to the manager and the manager was so helpful and understanding. The servers and managers make me want to go back and try again but next time we wont be sitting at the bar.

This was an all you can eat so we took advantage of rolls we wouldn't normally order.   Again, nice looking place, decent price for all you can eat and if there wasn't Kama sushi, we'd come here again.

bd4TOl0kZNZhl6TyFdF3ow.text: Came here for a family lunch and it was pretty good.  It seems like they have a bunch of old menus mixed with new ones.  So if you see fried rice and chicken karaage then you have a newer menu.   We arrived shortly after opening at noon so there were only a couple of tables occupied.  We ordered some hot appetizers but it took them a really long time to get it out to us.  It took them 15 mins to bring out our udon noodle bowls and hamachi kamas.  The sushi rolls came out way faster.    Ok so the appetizers we ordered were: Hamachi Kama Baked mussels Udon noodles both chicken and the tempura  Shrimp tempura Bbq ribs Chicken karaage Chicken nuggets Beef fried rice Seafood boat  The Kama was good, nice and meaty with a nice dipping sauce.  The tempera was perfect, nice and crispy with not too heavy of a batter.  The karaage was over breaded, I think they used flour instead of rice flour for the breading.  It wasn't very tasty.  The nuggets were gross, never ordering that again.  The kids didn't even want to eat it.  The bbq ribs looked real tender and soft but it was really tough to eat, it was really rubbery and chewy.  Mussels were good  and udon was on point.  The seafood boat is a mix of raw fish (poke) with some tempura pieces.    So the cool thing about this place is that they actually let you order their special items even for lunch so we ordered uni, sweet shrimp and the giant clam.  Regular items were salmon and yellowtail with a double dragon roll.  The sweet shrimp came with fried heads.  The doubly dragon roll was shrimp tempura with eel and avocado on top, pretty tasty.    Dessert is ice cream (limited to 2 per person) or mocha ice cream (limited 1 per person).  Kids 3-6 are half off, 7 and above is full price.

qd0NB2aonSFzuT5OkarZ4g.text: There was a long wait. According to other reviews, that's apparently always True.  As an appetizer, I paid $4 for a couple of egg rolls that were about four inches long and the diameter of a dime. Come on now, really. The miso soup and the cucumber salad appetizers were about $1.50 each, I observed those portions were much better matched to the price.  The AYCE deal at Yama Sushi was a few bucks cheaper than Sushi Kaya about 14 mile up the street, but Sushi Kaya was somewhat better quality, and the service was a wee bit more attentive.   Pho Kim Long is just a few doors away in the same strip mall as Yama Sushi. No ACYE sushi at Pho Kim Long, of course, but the product is much higher quality, a nice meal, with generous portions, and you'll get out easily for the same price.  I'd take either of those places again before Yama Sushi. But Pho Kim Long is the best choice of the three, by far.  Guess I'm just not really down for these pig-out AYCE sushi food-as-fuel packed-mad-house joints.

4ICPxf5riYO-kn_kkb9cPA.text: You have no idea how many times I come here. The food and service is the best in Vegas. Sushi to rice ratio is perfect and each roll is a great size. The all you can eat is to die for. You will not be disappointed if you come here!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dragon Roll

WBFeSFoQVADJMHuduPrnTA.text: This has to be my favorite AYCE sushi in Vegas. As always though, expect a little bit of wait if you're going on weekend night since it does get busy, but it's not much of a wait since the venue is pretty large. I'd recommend to try the No Name roll and the Who's Your Daddy. Very good choice but also everything else; I havent found a rolled that's not worth ordering. For the nigiri, the rice to fish ratio is pretty well proportioned and the fish taste fresh. Their Soju and Sake are also good company with the rolls. Between two people, for AYCE and a bottle of Sake, our bill was around $50, which was definitely worth it in my opinion. Definitely coming back again and again.

6jRS_0cFRAqWFoQm5N3zmg.text: I thought I found my new sushi spot but I was wrong. I brought my boyfriend here for the first time on a Saturday night. Thankfully we beat the dinner rush because the dining room was half full. However, we waited for awhile and servers were walking by without a glance. I don't know if they have a scheduled host or it's just servers that sit the customers.  I don't know if their manager was off duty or the staff is normally not supervised. I've worked in the restaurant business before and servers were just all over the place. There was no organization what so ever. You can tell who is hardworking and trying to tend to their tables, and you can tell on who just doesn't want to work by standing at the micro...not doing a single thing. We were asked for our drink order 3 times but when it came to ordering more rolls, it was hard to flag a server down. Sushi came out fast, but whenever a server presented the plates to us, they seem confused or unsure if this was what we ordered. They brought us the wrong order twice and gave us full rolls instead of the half rolls we ordered. Sad to say, I will not be coming back nor would I suggest Yama to others.

JOiKR1hrZ9Vce3EmAxDgiQ.text: First time visit  Service......exceptional  Selection...exceptional  Now.....I'm a Makino fan and a friend suggested Yama. So why not? My summary is that Yama Sushi and Makino actually compliment each other so one is an excellent change of pace from the other  Can not go wrong with Yama Sushi Can not go wrong with Makino  Looking forward to coming back again and again

mmKsQCCWjp_69GC0mrhaHA.text: This place was just amazing! Employees are very friendly and even tho there was a 30 min wait to grab a table they worked really hard to speed up the process. Also, food was amazing. The sushi I had.

NzQ4PYf4F5yAaMIaSFAHrQ.text: Got seated right away , and servers were really nice. The food was delicious, got to try the California Roll!!!!

HvABzwy3DmLzvYPyqfxIcg.text: My partner and I are so obsessed with Yamasushi. It's our absolutely favorite sushi place  here in Vegas and its AYCE! Everything here is beyond fresh and delicious. No absolute odor on their fish. Yamasushi is so generous with the fish amounts!  We've been here way too many times and never get disappointed . Every time people visit us from out of state we always bring them here and blown away by how amazing everything tasted.  The prices here are unbelievable and the quality is out of this world! I love everything here my absolute favorites are hamachi kama, yama crunch, double dragon, mackerel , unagi, salmon skin roll to name a few. Try the agedashi tofu, takoyaki, udon soup and if you're adventurous try Uni.Honestly can't go wrong with anything you try here. It makes me hungry writing this lol Service here is always fast and courteous. They have cute server nicknames. Our favorite server is Maleficent. She always has a nice smile on her face . She's awesome! I highly recommend this place. Seriously, give them all your money! Lol

6KeEHnFoE2zGvp8JFHyYwg.text: Food for me always comes out good, this is my fav place and I never go to any other sushi places, I've been going here for about 2 years now! I recommend  the "Ellen roll" it's delicious!!!

zao0-mBykWH76McVmluHAQ.text: My favorite ayce sushi spot Seafood Salad is a must ! Son of the beach is also great. Only complaint at this location was the size of the rolls. A lot smaller than the original location, not sure why they are making their rolls so small. Hamachi Kama and Salmon Kama are both excellent too. Pistachio ice cream very light not too sweet, works out great with sushi.

geiUmuVdbrXJh5Stky8WAg.text: If you are one of those people who loves sushi so much, THIS IS YOUR TO GO PLACE!! They have AYCE lunch at 12P.M- 3P.M and dinner at 3P.M- 2:30A.M. This place is usually packed at night time. Customer service is excellent. Food quality is really good. I recommend coming here with your date!

K63AmaQ3OqUTTQ6Vk39EKw.text: Great quality all you you can eat Japanese food!  Probably the best sushi joint I've ever been to. The wait can be a bit long but it's totally worth it.  Good parking too!

Ohaun8iHXy6qMJnSVD7RCQ.text: Ehh.... rolls were the size of gas station sushi, disguised with a lot of rice. Don't be fooled by the photos- rolls are the size of a half dollar coin.   Service was decent but they forgot our miso and brought us an extra salad and hinted that it was our fault when we told them at the time of ordering appetizer we didn't want it anymore. Didn't really taste a lot of the fish since it was masked in a ton of sauce.   Overall restaurant seems to cater to those who want the ayce experience and haven't had decent sushi before... if you catch my drift............

O2xTteJ8Ytpi2I39MPCFZw.text: My favorite AYCE sushi spot has opened a second location on the west side in China Town! I love the spacious, open restaurant. The other Yama location is soo packed that I always feel claustrophobic there. This location is bright, airy, and modern. I really enjoyed that aspect. The menu is the exact same and I even recognized some of the same sushi chef's from the other store. However, a lot of the food was different to me. The ponzu sauce on the seafood salad, for example, tasted different. Not as citrus-y. The rolls appeared to be cut smaller as well. For this reason, we ordered 2x the amount of rolls than we normally would. Pricing for lunch is $21.95 and dinner is $23.95 which is extremely reasonable!   I love that it's AYCE and you can get anything on the menu. First time there? I gotchu. Start with a seafood salad either mild or hot if you like spice. Then if you're into apps, the sesame chicken is good, as well as the tempura shrimp.  Then, bring on the rolls. My favorites are:  Happy Rainbow Sun Of The Beach Wet Dream No Name Ellen Roll Harry Potter  Many of these rolls are very saucy which is what I like. If you don't like saucy rolls, move on! My dining partner who had never eaten sushi before LOVED this place and cannot wait to go back. And we will be back.

or0ytYsXoh2MJHv46OLL8g.text: Sushi is delicious. Service is shit. Worked in the service industry for years and I expect great customer service. Jolibee (the server) was very blah and had negative energy. Many servers helped the whole floor so I'm guessing it's fair split of the pot amongst all of them. But her service was so bad that it made the experience unenjoyable.

8S3FU8mgBzK9Oh8sXlizTw.text: The best all-u-can-eat sushi in las vegas.  Get a seafood salad, and a palm job.  The best.

t1zpDhFEhncEL7ANlbFWtw.text: Yama Sushi has 2 locations un Las Vegas, one closer to Hard Rock Casino and the other in Chinatown, both offer all-you-can-eat sushi for 20.95 (lunch) or 23.95 (dinner). Their menu is big, and as longer as you can fit in your stomach, keep ordering, their service is really fast! Make sure you order the items selected as "one per person", those are special items and they are worth to order! #vegas #sushi  Ps.: Chinatown location looks fancier than the other but both service and food are the same, if you are in a business or romantic occasion, go to Chinatown.

5EdSkWALBglXISzGbfqNZg.text: Service was horrible at first, our server with the name tag "im a killer" was rude. She was tapping her pen trying to make us hurry up & order. 2gjFMFGka_IQabH7s3EDkQ.text: This place was absolutely amazing! Took my wife for a date because she loves sushi, I personally don't care for it but this place had me eating everything we had ordered. mfJ4E4S_EPmHUmJECbH2dg.text: Cleaner and better service than the original Yama. The food was the same good quality so far, during the three times we've eaten at this new location. Reservations are not necessary at this time. This new location is more spacious for larger groups as well.

RQASyHCKt6SXM-Xk08b3cA.text: The service here is exceptional! Our server "Tinker Bell" was very friendly and explained questions we had about the menu.
