M3UZw0Dc_T1hws80JeenUw.text: If only I can give more than 5 stars I will. One of the best sushi place in vegas. Must try all their special rolls! I mean...all of them! Outstanding customer service from Server leslie "bedman" and great ambiance to hangout. Two thumbs up!!!

g-9eXWoIaDTH7qs5bRA5TA.text: This place is so terrible! I never recommend anyone to eat here. It isn't worth it. I stopped there one Saturday, and the host seated two of us. Shortly after we waited 15 minutes for someone to take our drink order. Another 10 for our food order. It was terrible. We had a new server every time someone came by our table. They were rude and unhelpful. When our rolls arrive the servers stopped coming to our table. Eventually we had to wave the hostess down. She was helpful. The rolls weren't even all that good either. The California roll tasted really fishy. More fishy than usual. Like they used cheap imitation crab. I wanted more rolls but no one else came by and we decided to leave. Here's the funny part. THEY LOCK YOU IN! I think in fear of people eating and running (the all you can eat sushi). We had to go up to the hostess and ask for our ticket. She got it and I paid for it. My friend attempted to go outside while I paid and the door wouldn't budge. He turned and said the doors locked. He noticed The hostess slyly push a button under her stand and the doors unlocked. What the f*** kind of sh** is that?!! We ate there for lunch. I told her the service was awful and I plan never to return. She was snooty after that. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THAT NO ONE GO HERE! Save your time and money! Go somewhere else!

Olg-Dm9F5g62BtUu90dklA.text: Very disappointed. Every single roll, and every single nigiri we ordered was sitting on a puddle of 'ponzu.' (Ponzu is in quotations because it tsted like straight malt vinegar) even if it didn't specify that it would be there, it was. This resulted in soy paper becoming soggy and unwrap from the rolls. It causes the rice, which was rather chewy, to crumble upon pick-up and impossible to stay together. It all just fell apart. All the rolls ended up tasting the  same. No matter what different ingredients, they all just tasted like vinegar. Maybe the fish was smelly, and they did this to disguise it? Tempura was lukewarm and chewy/old tasting. Green mussels were the equivalent of chewing an ear. Firecracker had dried out overcooked spicy tuna inside that they tried to hide with a quart of mayo. Green tea ice cream tasted like an old lady's perfume. We're not surprised the place was dead. Service was very friendly and fast, so there's that, but we won't be returning.

4T15L82LK1r4vrHk1YNS6g.text: Really great food and service. We got all you can eat for 23.95... and we stayed a while and really chowed down and enjoyed ourselves and got our monies worth.  Worth a visit... 4 stars only because I dislike the parking situation in this particular plaza. It's a nightmare.

3d2-JbdP4FVuGVOysdwuew.text: I've been eating at this ayce location for a few times now. The reason is because the price is reasonable and their Hamachi kama is really good. Their sushi is ok to me. The tend to add more rice on the second time around when you order. I love their salmon belly but sometimes they are out. It's not bad for the price of ayce. I would suggest they should be consistent with the rice instead of adding way too much. It should be proportionate.

YFD23HS-1Xv4dXGkr6ueug.text: This is my favorite AYCE spot in Chinatown because they have the best SEAFOOD SALAD. The best kept secret for sushi lovers!!! I live for nigiri and it is great quality. The service is fast and the staff is very friendly. Thank you to the fantastic sushi chefs for preparing yummy food!   You guys never disappoint. And I love that this is the 2nd location.

o7491vyUUP7y1L1cj3oMcw.text: Absolutely my favorite place to eat sushi !!! Everything is so fresh and delicious !!

ikF2ldL3BgbKaAlNRXctNA.text: My wife prefers this place better than my own restaurant goyemon sushi. I am a sushi chef at another sushi place and we eat here at YAMA. My wife prefers it better!! The place is big and well decorated and super clean!! The waitress' dress like geishas and are super fast and the SUSHI IS PRETTY AWESOME!! Love how the HAMACHIKAMA IS PREPARED AND ITS ONLY 23.00$ for the sushi buffet ! Well worth it!!!!! Always coming to YAMA!!!!!

D4iA_jSHAutwEzDgCKRncQ.text: Fast service! A lot of different choice of food!  Great price for sushi. All sushi are fresh!

H4hoq9RdyBFa4FRXa47Z6w.text: Showed up and got seated right away even though we were waiting for people in our party to show up, which was really nice! Especially since it's cold outside and we didn't want to be sitting by the door waiting! The rolls were great! There were a few favorites we had - Sun on the beach, wet dream, and no name roll. I love how you can order half rolls!   The only complaints I had about the restaurant - I asked the guy dropping off our drinks what the price for AYCE was and he said he didn't know and he'd find out. I feel like that is pretty basic information for a sushi restaurant. Before someone got back to us we had already found the price ourself on the menu. I ordered some nigiri, and I was wondering why it took so long. Then I got excited because I saw it finally coming and they put it down at another table that got seated after me. Then I realized, they forgot my order. When I reordered it wasn't too long before they brought my order over. The dessert menu is tiny. They only have 6 things. 3 different flavors of mochi, and 3 different flavors of ice cream. My friends didn't like the texture of the green tea ice cream. I enjoyed the strawberry mochi and the pistachio ice cream. The parking wasn't the greatest. I was able to find a spot, but they weren't extremely busy. I could see it being a problem on busy nights.   When it's your birthday, which it was for the table next to us, they play the birthday song through loud speakers throughout the entire restaurant. This is good for a sushi restaurant. Usually they don't make a big deal about birthdays. I'm not sure if it was a trick candle, or if the lady was just older, but it took her about 6 tries to blow out the candle they gave her. So be ready!   All in all the food was good quality, and I love how you can order half rolls! The garlic tuna and salmon were good! Also, it is the next morning so it's safe to say, no food poisoning. It's good to be able to trust a sushi restaurant! I'd go again for that sun on the beach roll!

SjU5B0fQCrVSlDBtaSk8cw.text: I'm giving this restaurant 2 stars not because of food or service (both of which are 5 star) but because when my family went with several friends, 2 of us used cards and they FORCED an $8 tip from the only 2 card users. There was $40 in cash tip on the table when they took our cards and cash, but then took $16 by force without our consent so they lost that $40. No company should FORCE a tip. If you weren't gonna take that cash from our cash paying friends, it is unacceptable to steal it from card users. Will never use card here again, and other card users beware. However, if you're paying with cash, this place is very good. I give their food and service a 5.

-UEA8YXznPgZjf5FExLIsg.text: Best place to go on earth. Literally I havent te sushi anywhere else other than Yama sushi! Firecracker, I son of the beach, no name, one minute man, spider roll and The barbecue ribs are my favorite

O_hJNTXv3k4yrfzOohGqSQ.text: The best ayce (all you can eat) sushi place in Vegas.  Extremely affordable at $23.95 per person for dinner.  My wife and I were in sushi heaven.  You can order anything off the menu, and the menu is extensive!  From appetizers to entrees to desserts, this place rocks!  We enjoyed the specialty rolls, bbq ribs (kalbi), unagi sushi, saba sushi, soft shell crab, amaebi, mochi ice cream, and everything we ate!  Make sure you eat all your sushi including the rice as they will charge you extra if you don't finish it!  My wife and all ate about $110 plus if we were to order off the menu at regular price.  Thanks for the yummy sushi and will definitely be back if we are in Vegas again!

9uU0fTvwMTKyi6DJbryxDw.text: Sushi was delicious.  It may be my new favorite spot. Service was quick. Gets busy at 6pm on Friday, but we beat the rush and we're seated quickly.  Service was still outstanding even after a full restaurant.

7mdtkLvfLLMuodyoM3s4cg.text: This place replaced my favorite sushi spot (Doh) went in with high hopes and an empty stomach....  They were still remodeling from Doh's original setting so ambiance was a little ... Unorganized which is understandable. I love that they kept the bookshelfs, very homey feeling...  We went for my birthday dinner around 7pm, party of...5 adults and my 5 y.o son.   The place looked pretty empty so We were seated immediately.  Servers were nice and attentive for the most part.  When we eat sushi we always do AYCE, so we ordered quite a bit.  Rolls started coming in pretty quick.  They were Good, but nothing to rant about...I was mostly excited to try the Baked Mussels (these are one of my favorite dishes when i go out to eat sushi/seafood)... And I must say when they arrived, they looked good.  But after tasting them , I was sadly let down, the excessive amount of sirracha on top was just unnecessary.. To put it simply, i didn't like it.    I'm also going to say, beware of their spice meter, (little chili emojis in their menu) we ordered a roll that had a level one spice and it literally was like fire in our mouths.  While another roll that was level three spice tasted like nothing.    All in all, would come here again, only Because it's decent sushi.  But it's no longer my favorite sushi spot....

3ujv-kFsRot_L7W71OvHXA.text: Great new sushi place in Chinatown! Came here during lunch time and it was not too busy. Great inviting atmosphere and very spacious. There was 4 of us in our party and we were seated immediately. We chose a booth.   At this moment, the host asked for our drinks which was cool because we were really thirsty from this hot afternoon. I truly liked how clean their table was and the menu was easy to read with a wide variety of items to choose from. We all chose to eat all you can eat.   The server introduced herself and asked us if we were ready to order. Of course we were and ordered a lot of different sashimi and special rolls. All came out surprisingly fast for being a tad busy and seeing only 2 chefs at the bar.   All the sushi was beautifully presented and the quality and taste was great! Loved how the dessert section you get to choose 2 scoops of ice cream and 1 mochi which was a plus!  Love this sushi place and this really hit the spot! Prices was cheap too compared to other competitors.

FzUKe0hNL7toXNRrze-cYA.text: First time going to this location and although the servers were super nice they were extremely slow. Initially we ordered several things from the AYCE menu and it took them a good 25-30 mins to even check on us again to order more food. However I have to say the Seafood Salad was really good. We loved the original location on Flamingo but not sure if I will go back to this location.

yvqE35JGrqXg1ftIsDfw5A.text: If you follow my reviews, you'll know that food is just part of my critical five-star component. And Yama Sushi has it all; service, decor, professional service, half-size orders which enable a wider variety of tasting, and least of all, unbelievably exceptional sushi. sT_hZRbaPj6iQYGgLZUOiQ.text: Okay, this place isn't the greatest AYCE sushi.  Yama Sushi isn't my first choice for AYCE sushi, but we came here for sushi since a friend of mine wanted to come here for her birthday. Also, since it is a central location from our friends in the Southwest, Northwest, and Henderson. I've come here a couple of times before. It has definitely been a minute since I last visited, and I didn't remember why. Now, I definitely remember. Frankly, their food just isn't good.   We were sat pretty quickly for a party of 5. It took a couple of minutes before our order was taken after we were sat and given waters. On top of that, it took a while before we got our appetizers that our sushi rolls came before our appetizers. I ordered garlic edamame and gyoza to start with and the garlic edamame was gross. The garlic was like soggy and the edamame seemed like it was drenched in oil. The fried Gyoza came out okay on the other hand. Not super flavorful, but just OK.   When I order from AYCE, I get a caterpillar roll and dragon roll right off the bat. So, their supposedly "eel sauce" is gross. Instead of that nice, slightly sweet, slightly salty, smooth, translucent, light brown color, I'm used to seeing drizzled over my sushi rolls, the "eel sauce" at Yama Sushi was dark AF, tasted super salty and slightly burned. It just ruined the roll. We also tried some of their specialty rolls, and it just was no bueno.  I also usually order soft-shell crab rolls, which they didn't have much to choose from. Their crab rolls were super plain in flavor. I figured I would try the "Palm Job", and it didn't satisfy my craving for that crunch that you get from eating a soft-shell crab.  I think the only good thing here was the sweet shrimp since it came with a fried shrimp head and their green muscles not being burnt. Also, the BOGO sake, which ended up to be ordered wrong due to miscommunication. We wanted two of the bottles of sake and we ended up getting four.   Overall, my sushi craving has not been satisfied. I definitely remember why I don't come to Yama Sushi.

Hi5qsXxD0yT2cXZhYZl8Qw.text: This is a gem of a place if you're into eating a variety of different  types sushi, but hate to deal with the mass produced sushi that comes with going to a buffet style sushi place. Parking can be very hard to get, but we went during an off time so it wasn't a problem. From the time we walked in to the time we left, the whole staff here was very nice and very attentive. The sushi was well made and very delicious. We tried various types with some interesting names. All arrived at the right time. I highly recommend this place.

VMSB-kJKtjo9qJNTYDTnNw.text: We're creatures of habit, especially when it comes to sushi and dining out. Once we find a good sushi spot, we seldom stray from it, if at all. But today, wifey and I decided we're missing out if we don't venture outside of our usual AYCE Sushi place so we decided to go play "Yelp Roulette" and select the first restaurant we scroll to--and Yama Sushi it is! The restaurant is situated in the heart of Chinatown on Spring Mt. with a nice clean and open ambience looking ready to accommodate large groups. We came in early before the rush crowd and was seated fairly quickly. The wait staff is swift to get our drinks and orders and it came in just as fast. So why only 3-stars? Well, our issue is the sushi itself--the food is quite sub-par, not that bad in taste or quality but nothing exceptional either. Also there's something off about the sushi rice, and as a sushi master once quipped, sushi is all about the rice, the fish is just condiment. Which leads us to the fish, the quality is again a bit below than what we're used to, especially the scrap-looking (and tasting) hamachi (yellow tail), low-grade salmon and the (brownish) uni. We're not expecting Nobu level sushi-grade fish for the moderate entrance fee we're paying, but it doesn't take a rocket scientist to figure out the proteins being used isn't fresh or good enough quality especially when comparing them to other places we've been to that charge for the same price yet offers better quality food. Yama Sushi does have a lot of patrons flocking in, we won't be one of them and I guess it's back to our tried and True usual sushi place.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy hamachi roll and ama ebi

LEXrPuwJRbyQ7CnbztvQ1A.text: Yama Sushi has expanded from their original location on Flamingo and Maryland Parkway and decided to give their Chinatown location a try.  "Nothing beats the original" holds so True.  There is nothing really wrong about this location, just not as good as the original.  Here are a few examples:  The uni was a little skimpy, didn't completely cover the rice.  Rice for the sushi was a little more and pieces of fish not as generous.  The hamachi kama didn't have the nice crispy exterior and not as moist inside.  For the positives: only 5 - 10 minutes from the Strip, a better neighborhood than the Maryland Parkway area (don't want to offend anyone here, if you are familiar with East Las Vegas, you know what I'm talking about), the service is still very good, and it's not as crowded with immediate seating.  You can't beat the price, it's still a few bucks less than comparable sushi AYCE restaurants.

dtGPw3DWVJbb9TpZSJe7og.text: I really really like this place and I always want to come here when i'm LV! I think their other location is better, but this one is just as good too.   I enjoy their efficiency and accuracy when it comes to customer service and food. I could NOT believe how fast they were in delivering the food to our table. I love how the AYCE includes apps, and desserts! Love their offerings of short ribs, katsu, karaage, teriyaki, seafood salad, poke, etc. the list goes on!  My favorite sushi options are always something with unagi.  The MOST popular one is the "no name" which is #24. I see why everyone gets it. it is sooo flavorful and captures unagi with salmon and shrimp tempura. Mmmm. I also like their #34 Spicy Sexy Roll for their take on spicy sushi, and really, almost anything here is good. I just don't care for deep friend rolls.  Some rolls were smaller and not as detailed, like the philly roll and the unagi. I thought it still tasted fresh, not like a sushiland. But I think b/c they strive to be quick, the details get lost. Otherwise, pretty cheap for AYCE ~23.95 and for the most part, I think their sushi and appetizer offerings are really worth it! Now i'm getting hungry!

-Fk6D6IynEJftTsBWo507w.text: I have only 2 Sushi  restaurants in Las Vegas that I go to & this is one of them! EXCELLENT food!!! Try number 4 and number 7

KxFiEc0BwE_07iGSsOyWOg.text: All you can eat!!?! OMG!! This place is so Ono(delicious) Only bummer is they were out of baked muscles which is my favorite. But next time in am in Vegas I am definitely going to be back. They were super fast and friendly. Each plate was well prepared and tasty. The price was totally worth it. We went with a group of four and had a great time. FYI order what you can eat. They will clearly communicate any wasted food with be charged to you separately. It's as many dishes as you want and desert is also included.

N5HQYkOfIyYXKbpasgMaOA.text: $21 for AYCE lunch sushi is not bad at all.  Another standard 1.5 hour limit and lunch hour can get pretty busy. We had to flag our waitress a couple times to get our orders in.    The mochi part of the ice cream was hard and inedible, so that was downer.  There is no sashimi,  so that's another knock.  The decor is nice,  but the torn both seating was a bit of a turnoff.    The sushi rolls are standard,  most have too much sauce doused all over.  There was a decent amount of specialty rolls to choose  from, so I stuck to ones with less sauce.    To end on a good note,  the soft shell crab, shrimp tempura and hamachi kama is good.  The fact that you can order half rolls is a great way to eat at a sushi buffet.

x7a9D9Ptpr3TgOHL4NZx3Q.text: Feel like this place needs a higher rating. The servers were very attentive and on top of our orders. The rolls were amazing and came out quickly. Ambiance is nice as well. My favorite roll was the I Love Salmon roll. I also had the Yama, Philly, Sun of the Beach, and Snow in Vegas roll. Wasn't a fan of the Fire Cracker. Shrimp tempura and spicy edamame was delicious for appetizers. Give this sushi place a chance.

We ordered half of everything we ordered so that we didn't get full on just one or two rolls. The names for the rolls definitely were eye catchers . ReyRjfgNCZWp8djAR6teLA.text: This is my favorite sushi place in all of Las Vegas. They have two locations- but this one is better! The decor inside is beautiful and the staff is so attentive. Every person who walks by will take your order and grab you anything you need.   Get the all you can eat- it's so cheap and worth it. Get soup, rolls, sashimi, dessert etc!   The no name roll is the absolute most delicious thing in the world- trust me!!

CiQ-Kv3YClhMJ4zEaXVfqA.text: This is the top Sushi restaurant in town! Great customer service ! The food is indeed exceptional.  I have been to the one on Maryland for the past few years but I love this second location more . The staff is much friendly and so attentive. You have to do AYCE!!!!

6-JV4lbQMDIgZp4KcTbHiA.text: The sushi quality is good and the prices are fair but the service is pretty bad (very slow, cultural/language barriers), the location is kinda sketchy and the restaurant smells fishy (which it shouldn't, despite the fact that they serve fish, the smell comes from a lack of cleaning). I wouldn't never have stopped here, let alone eat here, if it wasn't recommended by work friends.   They take much longer than they tell you when you do pickups and only accept calls at EXACTLY 12noon - not a minute, not a second earlier.

DVLKyIFuwX6sRyB7d8P6_w.text: This place is really good. Friendly staff. Easy going atmosphere. Had for lunch Turning Japanese Roll (damn good) Massago, Uni, Saba, giant Clam, oh my Yama roll, trust me baby.  Ask for Sushi chef - Yolo.

DNETQjtouwh3xPtNITr4yw.text: We decided to try the AYCE lunch ($20.95). They have so many different choices so you better come hungry. I recommend the "Son of the Beach" and "Crazy Roll". They're  #7 and #26 on the specialty roll menu. They were the tastiest and most memorable for my boyfriend and I. We also love our yellow tail tuna nigiri sushi. Nice and simple with some soy sauce and wasabi. Good Hamachi is what makes us keep coming back for more.  The service was very fast and very attentive. They went out of their way to make good menu recommendations and never let our drinks go dry. Definitely one of the better sushi places we've tried since moving to Las Vegas. Can't beat the price for AYCE also.

TVg3sn7WbK7FlaxOX6L0yg.text: Late review but I love this place! Great fresh food , clean, relaxing atmosphere!  What more can you ask for? My favorite roll is the shrimp lovers and the smoked salmon. My husband loves the spicy tuna rolls and sweet shrimp.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best sushi!

v6BpbFjBWPxr_5cwIKb5Vw.text: Love this place! This is the only sushi place in town my family will go to! It's fresh and tasty! It's all you can eat for a very reasonable price! We drive 30 mins from my house just to eat here! I love Yama sushi!

n-1-EAr7S6jyAG8Nzkaimg.text: They used to be named, "Doh Sushi & Tapas" but renamed to Yama Sushi. This restaurant is the "cousin" I would say to Tofu Hut KBBQ and Doh KBBQ. I occasionally go to this sushi spot and had been here since they have opened a few years ago, and I they have improved. Parking is pretty difficult to find, especially on weekends but the wait time at this place is short. Whenever I get there it is empty or I get there before the rush starts.   They have a modern touch to their environment and I really like the ambiance. Since I have been there I have not experienced a stable server, which is fine because every server around (although they are assigned) are easily accessible if we needed a refill on a drink or to place another order. Portioning is a lot to me and they do not offer half sized rolls upon me asking so beware of that. I really love their garlic tuna out of everything else on the menu and when it comes to dessert their ice-cream banana tempura is delicious. The banana tempura is a part of the AYCE (TYJ!!!) usually some places only limit you one mochi per person but they do not do that with the tempura. Dinner price is about $26 per person for AYCE but I am not sure about lunch price because I have never experienced lunch here.   ***LAST CALL is 12:30/1am*** I remember coming to this place around that time and they said they could not serve me because they closed at 2:30am, and that was not enough time for their sushi chef's to bring out our orders in time. Last call is pretty earlier than most places because I have been to another sushi spot that closes at 2am and still accepted people at 1:30/1:45am.

kt-WpqOKmylfoM5bHxAr2w.text: Everything is fresh and tastes great, we love the all you can eat, can't beat that! Specially if you come here after work, lol. Place is cool like this location better then the E. Flamingo location, the only down side is the parking, parking sucks, sometimes you have to park in the back of the building and walk all the way around, i guess it's a good exercise after you do the all you can eat! Friendly staff, and clean! Good Job Yama Sushi!!!

GvJceqesrRqsryDC29xTLA.text: I love this place. The Wet Dream roll is by far, the best roll. This location seems a bit bigger and nicer. It's a great price for ayce. Make sure you order a few rolls at once, especially if they're baked because it takes a while to get them. I'm glad they finally opened a second location because it was always super packed with really long wait times. Definitely worth going to.

mjDwNYut4Pi3_oG_Azzf5w.text: Nice environment in a fun part of town.   However; sitting at the sushi bar, we frequently found ourselves with empty plates, looking longingly at the sushi chefs - trying to get some attention. We had to actively flag down waitstaff to get refills on water or tea.  It wasn't a particularly crowded or busy evening. When someone is three feet away, and repeated "Excuse me's" are not acknowledged... Well, we definitely felt ignored.  The food... eh.... on the average side of average. The nigiri pieces were decent sized, but the rice would not hold together, and was fairly bland. The rolls are exactly what you expect at this kind of place - funny names, but no more than serviceable as food.   I've had much better experiences at the East Side Yama, even though it is loud and tightly packed.

cZbXczxR1472FPo-zc_jQA.text: Their was no host to take the names of the people walking in, and once the host came i asked her if I could put my name in the list and she just knotted her head then she goes to a party that was before us to take the name and after she goes to a group that got there way after they got there maybe like 15 min after in that moment we just left the restaurant, they need a HOST not someone that doesn't know what's happening!

0x8aWVpTuCBZc3EoABaAmw.text: I likes it. I likes it a lot.   Great place located in Las Vegas' China Town. Clean and good service. Ask for MagicMike. He makes a killer SpiderRoll.   We plan on returning! Take advantage of the "All you can eat sushi" special for $23 bucks!

9dgrVpmDizaHkhyM1XDeqg.text: A party of 9 for a friend's surprised birthday dinner went well. All you can eat for $ 24-30. All the baked sushis would take a while so I suggest getting them first. Wet Dream is my favourite then second would be the Man Whore. Enjoyed the whole dinner with staff singing happy birthday with a cute mochi ice cream dish. This place never disappoints me.

hytKWYQ8FyvZIiqW4PfgPw.text: My friends and i went in for AYCE cause this is the usual spot we go to it's barely about to be 2 am and they told us they were closed and gave us attitude ..

mS3eRp_jDt9_8Lh-qFuh9w.text: No other sushi place like it. Simple yet unique with the flavors. They have so many different rolls. Service is always great when we come. A MUST have if you're in a Vegas and are looking for some BOMB sushi! Highly recommend!

dizC2xPEQmTKEkhaMdfBGQ.text: Found our new sushi groove. Everything was fresh. Service was friendly and attentive. Food came out pretty fast. Like the ambiance. Definitely we will return.

45m5K0cgircfMfbjh-G5Fw.text: The food looks very different from what were posted here. The food wasn't fresh and service was bad. I would not recommend this place at all.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zMfqwlsLXdACo3VeTYQxSQ.text: First of all, I don't know why my review from Doh (the old sushi place before Yama came in) got transferred over to Yama Sushi's review. That's not fair for them!  But I finally got to try out this new additional location for Yama Sushi. As usual I've ordered my usual favorites:  TNT, Firecracker, No Name and Happy Ending. Of course, the Seafood Salad.  As I was going through the menu, I noticed that there are some new rolls on there. Like Trust Me Baby, Fish and Chips and You the Man Too! They are new, right? I must haven't been paying attention to the original location's menu. Ha  Service is the same, still attentive and caring. But what knocks it down from a 4* to a 3*? It no longer has that home-y feel. The mom and pop store ambiance. It's commercialized or feels like a franchise.   I'd def come back but to the original location on Flamingo and Maryland Pkwy.

XdAVSoXNJ5KIkOLXNBtP5A.text: For a buffet style restaurant, it was great!  The food was like a great sushi place!  I ate more nigiri then I ever ate before :-) :-)   Order everything fresh! The waitress was excellent  All of them helped you at anytime!  They got lower reviews cause of the previous restaurant they took over the yelp.  But their first restaurant has great reviews, so we tried it. We love it. Will come back if we visit Vegas again

Hj4HIEOqUXsuSclNpbv4TA.text: A must whenever we are in Vegas. All you can eat, fresh sushi and sashimi and uni. Loved the price

HkZgkaoBqOQY9earjIXkqQ.text: This is an awesome sushi place in Las Vegas! I think there is another location not too far from this one, maybe just as good. Anyway, the food is great! The freshest fish I've had in Vegas in a while. This might be my new favorite sushi place in Vegas. It's all you can eat, and the prices are unbelievably good!

ZH4sO-UZJvEr46_nEyYNAg.text: ***OFF MENU ITEM/TIP***  Ask for your sushi/nigiri "Sexy Style" its FREE and includes a slice of avocado, think slice of lemon and a slice of jalapeno...thats right, FREE avocado!!!!!!!!!!!  I am from Los Angeles, home to some of the countries best sushi restaurants and most high-end restaurants.  Further, All you can eat sushi is a BIG no no in Los Angeles.  All that being said, I LOVEEE Yama sushi, I make it a point to go every time I am in town.   My go-to: 1. Garlic tuna, Sexy Style-- You can message me and thank me when you try this.  I literally order 10-15 orders for myself...its like candy 2. The no name  If you have a friends birthday, HIGHLY recommend you tell them its someone's birthday.  It's SUPER embarrassing.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Tuna, Sexy style (Avocado, lemon slice and jalapeno)  Its so good that I order this much for me and one other person

Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mix of rolls... The no name and Garlic Tuna, Sexy style (Avocado, lemon slice and jalapeno)

HgoNkt5p2aF7_CCSsHAqrQ.text: This is my third visit to this Yama Sushi location. I keep saying " well, let's give it one more try!" Unfortunately, it gets worse and worse every time we come here.  It's a very busy location, being that it's in a very busy plaza in spring mountain. We waited 40 minutes to be seated (which should've been a giveaway that we should probably leave, but I'm not blaming the restaurant for the wait), and were pretty ignored throughout our stay. I had to physically get up and ask a server to order more food to get attention.   The sushi is nothing special. It's not particularly fresh so I'm not sure what the raving reviews are about. On one of the orders of salmon nigiri that I got, there was a brown spot at the end. The special rolls were fine as they were soaked in various sauces to cover the taste of the extremely bland fish. When they served us the tempura udon, they did not separate the soup and the tempura and by the time we were done eating it all the tempura batter had fallen off and into the soup and made a huge disgusting mess.   After a certain point and we just gave up. We didn't even want the dessert so we waited for a server to give us the check, which AGAIN, nobody came to our table despite making direct eye contact with them. I approached the server and asked to pay. I gave her my card and she told me to sit down while she rang it up and was promptly gone for 10 more minutes.   It was a blessing to leave. I'm not the kind of person who will eat at a restaurant and then demand my money back so I'll at least IMPLORE everyone who goes here: there are better sushi places around! Please go there and not risk food poisoning like I'd gotten that night.  To top it all off: C grade high on the wall we didn't see until we were walking out. Lovely.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Probably try somewhere else until they get back up to A grade
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What was left of the tempura batter in the soup

1uWcG1yVSBp2rfqiCc8h0g.text: Came to this place several times for the past years. The reason I kept coming back because of the food and the atmosphere was / is always great . The service always great . Nice and friendly .   The reason I gave this 3 stars this time is because I came here yesterday for lunch (@12:30pm on Sat 6th). Obviously they just opened . After I ate. I went to use the restroom and it was super nasty and disgusting like they never or hadn't clean it for days!! It was all yellow and the tissues was everywhere . Or maybe because it was busy the night before and the staff did not get a chance to clean it or something ?? I'm not so sure now if I will be back . Probably might go to a different location or somewhere else instead .

VpV6KdRlrKhvdWy3e5YSnA.text: I walked in after getting a massage next door. It's hard to find parking around. There was a 15min wait. I ended up sitting at the bar. This place is popular but hectic. I am freezing cold my whole visit. Shivering. I ordered as soon as I sit down. I wanted to order to take home so I have food for tomorrow but the waitress convinced me to do the " all you can eat". Baked mussel : really good Fried gyoza : ok, different than I know Sesame chicken : DO NOT ORDER - I sent it back to the kitchen, it's not edible, dry no flavor  Vegetable fried rice: dry, no flavor, where's the vegetables? Strip tease roll: decent, spicy  Dancing in the sheet roll: yum, sweet Special yobo roll: my favorite even it's not mind blowing  After this I gave up, you will never see me again. I only liked the mussels-/ All staff is very kind, waitresses were super sweet. Food just not that good.

LlhHXliCVZXuZNt9xRdFlA.text: I think this place is AMAZING. It definitely deserves a higher rating. Coming here for ayce sushi was the highlight of my entire trip to Vegas. I LOVE THIS PLACE and wish there was one back home so I could come more often. Definitely will visit again when I come back to Vegas.   Ayce sushi was $20.95 for lunch - a great deal imo. There is an incredible selection of appetizers, nigiri, rolls, hand rolls, etc. It's amazing!! My friends and I ate so much (each totaling about ~$60 worth of food) and left incredibly satisfied. The sushi itself was very yummy, especially the salmon nigiri!! The fish to rice ratio was on point! Also, get the mochi ice cream! Highly recommended in all of these yelp reviews and pretty good!

_S__tr_UBEKt3ewCtfQhbw.text: If I could put 6 stars, I would. First of all, the way the workers are in here are PHENOMENAL. They are always kind and helpful which is one of the reasons why I'm here 24/7. The look of the place is really cute and comfy with nice little booths. There are LED lights behind the sushi bar that change colors which is nice to look at. The chefs work their asses off and get all the orders out quickly with precision. I personally am a nigiri person and I always get the salmon because it is super FRESH. Also if you happen to be waiting for a table I recommend asking for MIMI'S section she has been helpful and incredible each time I come and she always has my order almost memorized.

cOBgPcfTlEqs6wKsQRcNsw.text: My favorite AYCE sushi spot in town. Great options, a bunch of appetizers, the unlimited food is great however keep in mind that no waste allowed so the option of half rolls is awesome! staff is fantastic ! Love it

Tp9GGPOLyJI4qGmtmAuMGg.text: Overall this place is pretty good for AYCE sushi:  Here's what i mean  1 - Tons of choices and selection - Self explanatory. But this place has more so than a lot of other AYCE places.  2 - They are really good about not loading up on fillers - example, The first thing I noticed was the Sushi isn't loaded with rice.  The batter on the tempura wasn't loaded with flour.  The ratio of Protein to fillers is darn good.  If you go to most AYCE places, they LOAD on fillers.  I am impressed by the fact YAMA does not.  We ordered at least 6 rolls, and finished them all.  Good luck with that at any kind of other sushi place.    That alone is worth the 5, says this place doesn't try to skimp or try to fill you up with rice, just because it's AYCE.  3 - The speed - There's something to be said about this system.  We ordered at least 15 different items, and NOT one was missed or in error.  And almost all our orders came out within 5 minutes of ordering. In fact, my SO forgot some stuff she ordered!  The downside to this is that we had to eat super FAST and stuff food down, just to keep up with the food that was coming to make room at the table.  4 - The quality was decent -  I don't expect super super quality or expensive ingredients at an AYCE place.  I think that's asking a bit much.  But the quality was decent, clean, didn't get an upset stomach.    That's my box of chocolate on this place!

3F3D8YwlzEaZZijt-BglRQ.text: BEST SUSHI IN VEGAS! CHANGE MY MIND! Yama is perfect! Specifically the one on Spring Mountain. The atmosphere is amazing for dinner with friends or even date nights! There is almost always a 15-20 minute wait, sometimes even 1+ hour wait during dinner time (6-7pm) it is so worth it though!! Even if you don't like sushi I would still get AYCE and just get tons of appetizers and small side dishes. Sushi comes out super fast and perfect every time. They pretty much know me there already. Yama on Spring Mountain is my go-to spot for dinners with friends and when my sisters and I need to catch up with life. If you're looking for amazing sushi in Vegas. You found it.

33blRReuaM54sJHn2enJkQ.text: I'd like to say that this place is really good when it comes to fresh sushi.  The waiters are super attentive, hadn't even finished one roll when they are ng offering the next one! The ambient is pretty upbeat and outgoing.  Although there might be quite the people surely the staff manages to maintain a great attitude all around.  The maintenance in the place is well kept... I would recommend you take a look at this joint and visit it when you're around! This is the second restaurant they have in town as far as I'm concerned and they sure stand up to their name!

rOl_SXlJSzi3RYicOEBQsQ.text: Having dinner with my friends/co-workers at our favorite sushi bar. I started off with the "Roger Roger" roll. Very good start. I'm on my 3rd and 4th roll now, "Sun Of The Beach" Great service as always. This is my first time Yelping here!

cEmodSKzOO6ym1VWVpdQtA.text: This off the strip sushi location is a great place to enjoy a meal privately or in a group setting. The decor is modern and the music is current to the pop and hip hop scene.   Deliciously crafted sushi specials rolls and many other items to choose from. Come with an empty stomach and remember, slow and steady wins the race at this all you can eat sushi restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Edamame - Comfort Food

CXOunSVHXDHSbhniEL6xLA.text: This was our first time eating here as we normally eat at Hikari's.  It was a recommendation from relatives so we decided to try it out.  We got there at about 8p and the place was packed.  There was about a 35 minute wait.  My cousin was surprised that the wait was that long especially for a week night.  This restaurant has all you can eat (AYCE) and you can also order off the regular menu as there are different rolls and items not on the AYCE menu.  We just ordered off the AYCE menu but next time we'll order of the other menu as well because the rolls sounded delicious.  What's really cool about this place is that you can order HALF ROLLS!!!! Which means you can try smaller portions if your unsure if you'd like the rolls.  What I didn't like was the soybeans coming out hot and not cooled down.  It's not something that I care for but that's my personal preference.  The service was ok.  They were very busy and they didn't check on us much.  The only time they would really come to the table was when they would bring our ordered items.  Other than that we would have to flag them down.    When I return to Vegas, I would eat here again.

But added jalapenos and lemon on top! Don't knock it until you try it! It's the bestttt to add to sushi!   He only thing I suggest is to bring your own serving utensils if you are not a fan of plastic to serve as family style (a little difficult)

We enjoyed the double dragon, you the man (spicy), snow in vegas, kiss the ass, dancing in the sheet, and the happy ending.   Overall we really liked the service and food here. Definitely a place to hit for lunch. The restaurant was packed and is right in Chinatown. Don't expect a long wait for the food as it comes out rather quickly.

KrkWp61FEVN5yl5foKJS6Q.text: This place gets busy. As in, they ran out of menus they could give to people busy. As in, at Saturday 6:30, if you go in with a party of four you're in for an hour wait busy.  I only get nigiri at AYCE places, and I got a pretty broad selection. Tuna, Salmon, Ikura, sweet shrimp, etc. I don't know if anything stood out as great, but the Ikura was enjoyable. The salmon in particular stood out as being not so good, and the tuna was forgettable.  But, when you go to an AYCE place you're not expecting the same calibre of fish as you would get at, say, Kabuto. That should be the expectation going in. And I found the fish quality, on the whole, to be acceptable.  Which brings me to the price point--at $24, this is a very reasonably priced AYCE dinner. That gets them up to 4 stars. If it were $29, it'd be 3 stars.   Service was friendly and attentive in spite of being very busy. That helps too.

pnGmp3Ekcy3Wud-84yAOIA.text: My cousin and I were super hungry from our 6 hour hike so decided to get AYCE sushi at Yama. Thinking it would live up to its sister over on flamingo, I was hyped.   Walking in, the place was big compared to a lot of the sushi places in town. Probably could fit twice the amount of people.   One of the workers was mopping which already gave me a bad vibe. Don't you usually mop before you open or after you close? It had a strong smell of bleach, which I am not fond of, especially while trying to eat.   Service was great! Water was refilled quite quickly, food was served pretty fast, and the ladies were always checking up on us, asking if we needed anything.   First up, some nigiri. Ordered the super white, yellowtail, eel, salmon, and albacore. Like another reviewer said, the rice was definitely not sushi rice. I usually order a ton of nigiri but these just were not cutting it. Slices were a bit more chewy than normal and if it came with a sauce underneath the rice, it over saturated it.   Second up, Uni. Now I've had some good and bad Uni and these were on the border. For me, I think Uni has a creamy texture with a buttery finish. These had a watery creamy texture with a fishy finish.   We also got the baked green mussels which had their version of a vinegar based sauce on it which were ok.   The best thing we ordered were the kalbi or short ribs. Can't really go wrong or mess those up.   I don't think I'll be coming back here.

XuIcfttydZw-JpRoIIJRqg.text: Good food fast service and friendly employees all work really hard to get order In and out really fast

jdb8is2K5wZC9At6qR5AYA.text: Worst tasting sushi. Sushi guy on far right side is the rudest.  Rolls taste like mediocre food. When you order AYCE... they load you down with rice on everything. Won't be returning here.

kbfXZaA4H3DpqSzgdz-0wg.text: The food was pretty good, but not the best. My only complaint is the fact that the customer service is really bad when they know that the tip is already included. My family of six had to pay $23 in tip to waitresses that don't even meet any standards when it comes to customer service. They really do need to work on that.

d_4QLqL97kSiirLBZ-4Mew.text: We stopped in for a last minute lunch on our way to the airport. AYCE sushi for $21 is a deal! The quality of the sushi was just decent. Our server (didn't get his name) was super nice!  I really enjoyed the rolls. Quality was not comparable to that of what I have here at home (in Hawaii), but it was still good. We had about 6 rolls for our group of 4, 2 shrimp tempura and chicken yakitori. I can't remember all the names of the rolls, but we did get a few that were suggested from the waiter, such as "no name" which was my favorite. At the end, we got 1 mochi ice cream each and a scoop of regular (japanese flavored) ice cream. YAY for a great deal!  Service was exceptional. There wasn't a lot of people in the restaurant while we were there, and our waiter was able to refill our drinks and check on us multiple times. Whenever I go back to Vegas, I will be back for AYCE sushi. =)

v9uvhH8TJRRKCPtDQ0rnqA.text: My family and I went to this location again and surprisingly the food was very delicious. We were seated in 5 mins (luckily we beat the dinner crowd). We were seated in the darker side which was a bit too dim to read our menus but it was alright and we used our phone light.  The food was very fresh and so good! As always the food here is pretty amazing.  However, I docked a star because the waitress forgot a few of our orders (AGAIN lol see previous review). So we realized we didn't receive our order about 20mins we asked our server again and she said that the order was never placed and she will make another one. I guess they did not have a pen or paper on hand to write all our orders in but I think in the future its okay to write it down and not have to worry about remembering all the orders being requested.  As a All you Can Eat this is the sushi place to go. We haven't ventured out to any other places yet while visiting Las Vegas.

L_C5IHqXDTd4-4SEcsuN7Q.text: Super disappointed in the service here from my past two visits. This is my family's favorite spot to eat and it saddens me that they have missed the mark with us twice in a row. I definitely understand being busy, but in my opinion it comes down to the servers and sushi chefs lack of communication. I've had to place orders in numerous times only for them to never make it to our table. Manwhore was made poorly and not baked long enough. Long wait to get seated, longer wait to get your food.   The reason this review is getting only 1 star is because they charged me 107.92 the first time because their cashiers put in a tip in the wrong amount. Although they voided it out and charged the correct amount I would have appreciated being in the loop rather than waiting for 20 minutes for our check and an explanation as to what's going on. A dismissive sorry and refusal to give the managers name did not make the situation any better.   I will say if you are lucky enough to have the young Korean lady as your waiter your experience will be nothing like this. She always remembers my son when we come in.   I really hope I'm able to come back to this review and rate Yama what it truly deserves but as of this moment I definitely think their staff needs to go through some training.

FhQiafnw05e5hARNZfjEVA.text: I came here because of Yelp reviews that said they had a peanut butter roll. Well, "that was the old place" was said a few times as I tried to get things people raved about on here. OK, the AYCE was priced average for what we are used to paying. The service was pretty good because everyone that works there comes by to see if you are OK or want to order again. I did like that somewhat. There was nothing here to rave about and we have a regular sushi place that we go to in Vegas and we will be returning to there next trip.  Just super bummed and felt like a "Bait and switch" kinda. Yelp needs to make places start over when the business changes it's name or ownership. IMO

FiEr-km_mTSuorH0osB0jQ.text: Disappointed with the serving sizes. I was here a year ago and it was double the size. Check the photo to see how management is cutting they're food costs. They used to be an amazing restaurant but now they overcharge for below average food and serving sizes. Such a shame. :(
