X9vpfOeu_Ha0jaiUCkzfwA.text: I loved going to the Yama near Maryland when I was going to UNLV! So I was ecstatic that they opened a location in Chinatown!  First off the space, so much room! Wide sushi bar, and plenty of tables. Several sushi chefs, and plenty of staff who check up on you, I think that's wonderful!   Sushi is tasty, and comes out fast. They have all the rolls they had before at the other location. Appetizers/sides are a miss for me here. Chicken skewers are hard to chew and dry, I don't recommend it at all. The hamachi kama and salmon kama was disappointing, both were incredibly small and dry.  Seafood salad has shrunk considerably. I would love to see Yama improve this.  I say save your stomach room, and just go for the nigiri and rolls. Do try thier baked rolls, its amazing in the mouth!!

1to-bGpfSfb6XW8ISi-J1Q.text: Ate here during dinner service. Chef Kiki did awesome job serving us sushi with great speed, but that is all. Major drawback with first experience was me and my friend waited for our hot food too long. We waited for our beef fried rice for more than 15 minutes. We ordered ice cream and it took longer than 5 minutes before it was served. It was not even busy during our first visit. Sushi is good, but service was bland and disappointing.

nhDfJM-zG67Ove6Xgw31Vw.text: Awesome staff! Very attentive, rolls are ready almost as soon as you order them. Ive never been a fan of hot sushi but their baked rolls were amazing. $23 all you can eat sushi!

r0BXxIh2bD5nOLzeIWN-3A.text: I was not impressed. And like another reviewer said the original is better. The server and useless.. when we came in the hostess was telling some of her friends that she hated working there and she was asking them if they were hiring. Very unprofessional. After waiting about 15 minutes to be seated in an almost empty restaurant we were put I a dirty booth. We placed our order and they started bringing out the food and it was quick so no complaints there but I took the first bite and was very disappointed. Then the brought us something we didn't order, we told the waitress and she took it back not ta minute went by when another waitress comes back with the item and she said you ordered this and my husband sits there arguing with her that we didn't when finally the supervisor comes and yells her to just take it. This stop made a great night end in a sour note. Never going there again and maybe this location might want to consider hiring competent servers/chefs if they did I'm sure they would have 5 stars.

7yc7cxP6hDczbInJTDGeig.text: Eat here all the time... Food is great.. service today sucks. Waiting 20+minutes to be seated when half the restaurant is empty. We asked for the bar which there are 8 seats open, and told we have to wait for a table. What kind of restaurant treats repeat business this way? I'm going to be sure and tell everyone to go somewhere else.

3twOr9cIiTHNbcrQ06G-Qw.text: This is our go-to when we're craving ACE sushi!  The other day, we got off to a wrong start with a rude hostess. But that quickly got turned around by attentive service we got. Shortly after we sat on our table, we got asked what we wanted to drink. Also, our server was always at sight so we never had to wait to get our orders taken which meant that we didn't really have to wait too much for sushi and appetizers.   Love this place & their Uni is fresh! I can tell with the taste. It doesn't have that strong taste to it

iacBKsYi-zznlBf73d9VbQ.text: Had a great experience at Yama sushi located at China town. Walked in and immediately was greeted. We then were asked for our names and how many people we had in our party. We just so happen to have two. They also gave us the option of choosing either a booth or table which is very seldom to hear as an option at a restaurant. The food was great and I would never mind coming back to eat.

jrU8TvPE3Bf-Bw5gn2U0hg.text: It was my first time eating here and I went with a couple of my friends. The place was really nice and clean and our service was fast as well. We ordered a bunch of sushi and they were all amazing and tasted really fresh! Would recommend to others if you want an ayce spot in Vegas!

rVkKL5G3mgwr94ihQQAs_w.text: It's in the heart of Chinatown.  We picked it because it was pack so that means food is good! Got in for 2 no wait they are pretty big for a sushi restaurant. Their waitresses don't keep still they circle the tables getting your orders in fast. And it comes out fast and delicious. We had the hamachi fresh as can be for the desert. Large portions too. We did half orders on Hawaii, sun of the beach, one night at Yama, oh dam harry! I will try the Harry Potter too! Will definitely come back again. Only thing missing my fried shumai. The appetizers were great too!

zTnZVZCp6amV0uXAccaNsA.text: ?   Yama() Sushi     Thought the service was bad but the food order was worst we order lots of difference plates on the menu but ended up getting the same order over and over and didn't really get the food that we order. Plus the one of the server look at us in a very rude way like judging us for ordering the drinks and talking about us at the cashier looking at us when we are still eating.

wAmD3SanPqwvAs4y2WHRYw.text: Ayce Sushi, just so good and the price is fair. Many rolls to choose from on their AYCE sushi menu.

--OU0Uot52qSkJxA7gqY8w.text: Yama sushi on Spring Mt is by far a go to restaurant. My favorite part about this establish ent is the quick service, great portion from fish to rice ratio, and how spacious it is inside. Will be back for another round of a sushi with friends.

AlCsJz5Srqw-UwyEhJN1PA.text: So I've tried the Yama Sushi on E Flamingo and loved it, but that location is always soo crowded. When I saw that a Yama was on my side, I was eager to go. Much to my disappointment, the service is horrible, the sushi is okay, and the selection is so much more limited. Sad to say, I will not be returning to Yama. I guess I will go to Umiya. Umiya has a much better selection and the quality is way better.

Zpml88Kq3rLz__Wexn5Wgg.text: I used to go to Yama sushi on flamingo and it was great food, just long waits in line. So my wife and I decided to try the spring mountain location for lunch. At first we thought it was great, and then we began to notice that it was not fresh fish. We both ordered seafood salad which is supposed to have assorted fish but they gave us 1 type of fish. I'm assuming they were trying to get rid of a certain type of fish to prevent waste. They also did it with my rainbow roll, I didn't see any tuna on the roll. Afterwards my wife and I spent some time in the bathroom, diarrhea trips for the rest of the day for both of us..... Never again will I eat at either Yama. I'm going back to my trusty sushi restaurant that never failed me with long waits or old fish.

mnaexjks3XO8B--PfTmmpw.text: I had dinner here last night and it was surprisingly pleasing, judging by its (current) 3.5 stars. First, the price was not bad for dinner at about $25 after tax. Second, service came around quickly and so did the food. There was no waiting around for anyone or any dish. Sometimes food that I ordered came around so quick I thought they meant it for the other table! Third, food was delicious. I was very pleased with the uni because I've had bad uni before and this was not it. The yellowtail was also nice and fresh. The rolls were also delicious, there was this one called sunset dreams or something that we all loved and kept ordering. Fourth, you can order half rolls! This way you get to try a roll without getting full. Fifth, there's a good selection of appetizers. I thought the soft-shell crab was a delicious item, and one that I hadn't seen in many restaurants. A lot of places service the spider roll but just the crab on its own is a whole another ball game. The yellowtail collar was also good as well. Finally, nice clean atmosphere and spacious setting. Overall, I loved it here and had great food that didn't take forever or cost a ton of money.

DQhAKEs1I9bK-m6C5WkJrA.text: Sushi is delicious and always tastes fresh! I wouldn't wait until your hungry to come here because they are always busy and will have to wait around for awhile, but it's worth the wait. PLUS, it's all you can eat! Yummy...yummy for my tummy.

HJaxy2limlK2HocAFYVnTw.text: Make sure you come before 1 am, the door says last cal is 2 am and they close 2:30 am. Came in on a Tuesday at 1:20 am, server rushed us and kept saying last call is now, so order. Didn't even have time to look over the menu. This was one of my go-to late night AYCE sushi places, but maybe I'll just take my business elsewhere.

O-cImpwmNqsyMbFHBag07g.text: Definitely great service here ! Carlos treated us very well.  Food was fresh. Hamachi kama is thr best, must have !!

2z6Ol0SkQINqarVC9k8Zag.text: Have been to both locations now, love this one! So beautiful inside! Staff was friendly and patient, attentive and although they were extremely busy, they still made time for our group of 4. We always do All You Can Eat and it's definitely worth it!

TwR8lYbTM482l0amvD0xLQ.text: Always go here every other week. A+ for good service  and great food. The servers are very attentive. All servers go around and serve everybody well. So please tip good.

6oDhkzEvTDY7GjfkM1qdcg.text: Very impressed with this place. Moving from Los Angeles, Vegas sushi could never amount to the dozens of amazingly fresh sushi places in LA. This was changed when I came to Yama. The fish tastes fresh, the service is quick, and the all-you-can eat option is totally worth your money! I recommend this place to all of my friends and it is my go-to sushi spot. It is a must try!

hFXxB0j7gtWUbx4M6P3WJQ.text: This is by far the best all you can eat sushi place I've tried in a very long time. The selection of the sushi was excellent. The other delicacies on the menu was also very good. You always leave this place super full!  It is well worth the money. If you come here make sure you come with an empty stomach because you will be leaving this place happily like a stuffed chicken!  A must go!

_BKV5NaXZmTtvb-M_DdCGA.text: Overpriced and low choice. No oysters, no variety of non sushi food in all you can eat. While declaring that they have KBB :(

wyDTmzASfH5B4Qhke4hVqw.text: First time was a week ago and than today  me and my boss went and it was amazing , We got seated right away both times , Got taken care of the servers are very attentive with us got us our drink right away , Get our orders in and the unlimited sushi is the best thing on the menu .  I have tried at least half of the menu and everything is so good . Favorite spot .

KZ33A1inocvpBEelgWuBnQ.text: Update, I've called back every day asking for a manager, I'm STILL horribly sick BTW, and still no manager there, they take down my #_ no one ever calls me back. I'll be reporting this company to channel 13 news

33hxbI95Fd1Tko9vTj7veA.text: It's my third time here this month and both times WOMENS RESTROOM IS BROKEN!!!! Come on you guys! You have to have a restroom if you are dealing with food! I can't even wash my hands, what's the matter with you, it's a must in a restaurant!!!

N7J08qJlpTvZFFMcDtbYOw.text: I love this place! The service is decently fast and the sushi is just so good. You can't beat the price for all you can eat and how good their rolls are.

bpyaCEh8VjwiKVmOsjHVog.text: I have been an avid patron to the yama on flamingo for years and this restaurant is just as delicious. My only problem with this new establishment is that drinks are not included in the AYCE price which is different the primary location on flamingo. I was a little upset when i got the bill with an extra 10 dollars tacked on so just beware. I feel as thought the servers should have informed us on this detail.

Qxmk3wFgCZ2bieiVsT4IWw.text: Probably the most popular Sushi place in Vegas. The sushi is amazing, but the space and service....it's really small and cramped. You're so close to the stranger that just got seated next to you and you feel like you can't have a convo with your guest. The staff forget to check up on you. They've got AYCE.

7fA2lwwHrmVSY4MTEhRsJQ.text: Our first time coming since new owners took over for Doh Sushi and I am very disappointed. We used to come to Doh 3-4 times a month and absolutely loved the variety of items on the menu which included no rice rolls(Johnny Roll and Rock N Roll), the spicy garlic edamame, the Coco shrimp, butterfly roll and the lobster roll only to name a few of our favorites. Now all the rolls of the new menu Yama has, everything is drowned in spicy mayo and it's so overpowering! Even the chef's spicy garlic sauce tastes like a spicy mayo and over powering. The quality of the fish was not as good either... The salmon was chewy and they took sashimi off the menu because they don't have high grade fish.  I am totally disappointed and disgusted by so much mayo and all the spice that it almost made me sick. We don't plan on coming back here anytime soon.

lAVWP3rN2s1LQwUiebicHw.text: Went to this location for the first time. Me and my bosses went here for lunch around 1.30pm. We had miso soup and it was a little salty. Together with miso soup we had soft shell crab , mussels, takoyaki (very disappointing), seafood salad, tofu, kama and some nigiri. Then my stomach started to act up. I am a sushi lover and never felt sick while eating it. UNI my favorite was disgusting! It taste bitter. The fish in our nigiri is not cold.. we told our server about it and he apologize and he said we need to comment on yelp coz a lot of people complain. He even said since they changed it from Doh to Yama they started buying low class cheaper seafoods/fish. He even told us that the sushi makers were stressed. Lol. And then I told him I feel sick. My stomach hurts he just told me to comment too at yelp! So here it goes..  I FELT SICK EATING HERE!!   Been coming back to the toilet since I got home!  Not coming back to this Location ever!!!

xTJWEK9zwxfmaLgtEO52Ug.text: I love the original and this 2nd restaurant is just as great!!  My favorites include the Harry Potter and Wet Dream!

HPAPz6EjZQEVUcxCRqlvVg.text: The best sushi spot in town. Everything here is good, amazing and delicious. I have been here at least over 10 times and EVERY time I visit its a 5/5 star experience. The waiters are super courteous, nice, and friendly. Sushi is pure and fresh. My favorite is the green mussels.

ycCDe-kONLlRV4rIogRFQg.text: Came here with my boyfriend for a quick bite before drinks at the Golden Tiki. Since it was just the two of us we told the hostess we'll just sit at the sushi bar. They weren't too busy for being on a Saturday night.. no wait for a regular table and pretty open seating. When we got to the sushi bar the sushi chef Ginie I believe his name was greeted us immediately. He was very nice and attentive. We had ordered two rolls and got them super quickly, but we didn't even have waters or anything, while we've already been sitting at the empty sushi bar for 15 minutes. Nearly done with our rolls I had to stop a waitress to ask for water.... and only 2 mins after I asked another waitress came and asked if anyone got our drink order. Thanks but, you were 15 minutes too late. The food was delicious, but service was nothing to return for.

4dgORHYnp5a19NKGuj1usg.text: Great food and nice atmosphere! Out of all the sushi AYCE places in Vegas,  Umiya and Yama are the two favorites!

KP3Zr4Dh2BsZY3VjCL5c5g.text: I have eaten here many times but the last two times have been horrible. I have even brought big groups here before. We walked in tonight and the place was not as busy and we asked for a booth. We thought the wait would not be long when we asked, but "Betty Boop" (they wear nametafs thatbare not their real names)said it was a 30 minute wait for a booth. We decided to wait for a booth and she actually seated us 5 minutes later. When we got to our booth, Filipino Server (Wolverine) didn't look like he was in the mood and actually looked very irritated when taking our order.   One of our Salmon Nigiri orders had bones in the fish or something crunchy but I believe it was bones. That's so nasty. This place was great when it opened but the service has really gone down hill. They don't come around and ask and follow up even if it was really slow. We had to ask for water refills twice.   I will say this that there are two or theee excellent servers every time we come here. Two of those are Mulan and Go Slow Bro. I don't know if I'll be coming back. Sushi Neko up the road may be my sushi choice when I'm in this area.

jONUVZsM28OPcw5ZlyMytw.text: I loved this place. Didn't realize there were 2 of these places. This one in particular was amazing and they were packed. I went in with a friend of mine and we did their AYCE sushi.   I cant begin to tell you how quick and attentive they were. When I say quick I mean we had 2 hours to kill and after ordering 5 separate times we still had a little less than an hour to go. I was stuffed and for $23.95 its a hell of a deal compared to some other sushi places.   Their Deep Fried Muscles were amazing!!! All in all I would totally recommend this place to anyone looking for a great sushi restaurant!

wkMcTlF8LYUFovjLlWO_8g.text: I got two rolls last night to go, they were ok. Usually places that are AYCE  give you small rolls obviously so people can finish their food but it you pay for rolls individually they are a lot bigger. I took my rolls back to my room and they were small rolls. They were the AYCE roll size. Taste was ok I felt they can do better. My total for 2 rolls plus edaname was $32.13 I provided them with $35.13 expecting my change back and while waiting at the counter the lady asked if I was expecting my change back?  I answered yes please. Not sure if it's just me but I like to see first how they provide everything before leaving a tip and honestly don't think people should just assume they're leaving the change as tip unless I tell you when I'm giving you my money. So once I get my food I check to see if every thing is there and it's missing my wasabi along with the ginger. Two of the most important things...I did not leave a tip.

qi4zQjkybCuFxjVqumq-og.text: My husband and I come here all the time and always have an amazing experience. And today's visit is no different!!! Everyone is so so nice! Especially #SATAN! Thank you #SATAN for making this visit so wonderful!! Thanks SATAN!

EEaIGqzUy9SkCjJ6BNFVnw.text: Favorite sushi place I have ever been anywhere!!! The service is unbelievable!!! They were packed but so attentive! Sushi all you can eat and they were fast. They brought roll after roll and were quick to help with suggestions. This was our first visit here and they brought us a gift. I can't say enough great things about this place!!!!

3hQjgszLbhWL8aEUFLSBHA.text: Since this now became Yama Sushi II it now has the quality  that we can expect from the other location on Maryland and Flamingo!  Friendly  staff, outstanding food. FRESH.  GREAT SUSHI.  great price.  All you can eat.  Do not let the other reviews scare you that is from the other sushi place that was in the same location!    Additional information!  No long wait like tge other location.  Plenty  of seating.  !

LArKq7xmazYHm4bFVyx3Fw.text: Great sushi and amazing rolls! This place has a great selection and everything tasted great. I would recommend this spot anytime in Vegas

tj0Rj4VGIb_TkRz-tQ0E_g.text: Minion & Sandy are Awesome servers...Very friendly & helpful w/menu selection...They're both an Assets to your restaurant...

SX-o_FD6d2cntb2I9vjYLQ.text: Love Yama sushi ! This location is much more spacious then the one on flamingo and was defiantly a plus. I will have to agree with some of the other reviews that the service was just ok, I wish I had gotten the gentleman's name that made the service ok . He was wonderful and personable as the ladies left me wondering if my food was coming and if my bill was going to be settled as it took a long time for them to bring it . The food however was great as always and I will return to this location and would still recommend this as one of the best ayce places around !

XpmFvfdxVk6kZYIfUgfdFQ.text: Overall this is a decent sushi joint. The atmosphere feels like a buffet. The waiters are friendly and the food was good. Lots of foot traffic during dinner time. The only problem I could name was that the waiters got confused with other table and kept bringing random food to our table that we didn't order. Which I thought was kinda funny. Also the bathrooms were some what clean. I would go back here.

lyBf2TncAUX670cY-Kao8g.text: For cheap all you can eat sushi this is the place to go. My friends and I usually end up ordering more than a hundred dollars worth of sushi each. The price here is unbeatable for the amount of food you can eat in a 2 hour time frame.

iBxdkQeUy8leCHmPiQgFJw.text: I went here for their $23 AYCE dinner and I thought it was average. Our server wasn't too familiar with the menu. Their miso soup was also a bit bitter. I highly recommend their soft shell fried crab and their baked and fried mussels. I wish they served oysters here. Most of the food that I ordered were from the appetizer section. I wasn't too impressed with the rolls we ordered either. I don't remember which ones they were but hopefully the pictures that I post will help. Sorry! One of them was the "Ellen" roll though. Lol it's pretty spacious inside and I really liked the lighted frames. I felt like I was eating sushi in the mountains. Lol if you're looking for an AYCE sushi joint, definitely give this one a shot.

aREp3RILKtfuG3HWTVdEUw.text: This place rocks!!! Ayce Sushi is my fav. You can eat any sushi on the menu. The service is great...the girls are on it. Parking is a breeze. It's not too far off the strip. Price is great...quite a bargain I think. This place is on my list to visit every time I come to Vegas!!! Great job people!!! I would recommend this place highly!!!

ah5iNq3YVTV-QK6d_ulfOg.text: I used to be a regular at doh. It was pretty good. I always got the all you can eat and left satisfied! Their rolls were so delicious! Now that it's Yama..... Well.... It's still delicious but they need fresher ingredients! The avocados in the rolls were almost black. The rolls kept breaking apart... Ah.... And not to forget..... THEY DO NOT HAVE ANY MORE TEMPURA ICE CREAM!!!!  All in all I didn't have a bad experience. The service was a lot faster than when it was doh! Of course we did go at a less busy time too. Anyways the only thing I really have against them is that they got rid of the most delicious ice cream on earth.

XCiRDTBD8uIvc8pFvFpDjg.text: Usually we have amazing service here. Tonight, was an exception. Our waiter "Johnny Bravo" was the worst human being ever. Lazy. Had an attitude. Can't take an order correctly. If you can't work with people, don't work in the hospitality world. He either needs to be retrained or fired.

jz1ArQI_K6SYDzQnv2FzEA.text: I had a horrible experience. Terrible service terrible sushi just OVERALL TERRIBLE. Why is everyone refilling waters and not taking orders for food? I had ONE CUP of coke the whole night and asked for a refill three times. Twice to the same waitress and once to the waiter serving the table next to us. I will never come back and would not recommend this to anybody. I hope they close down at all locations. I had a table of 6 and all of us had the worst experience of sushi EVER! But as soon as I ask for the check, they rushed it right back to the table in a heartbeat. All they care about is throwing nasty food (sucks to much to call sushi) and taking our money.

7btLyps_leA5bgfPiGfCXw.text: Yama Sushi was so good and a fun atmosphere! We had a group of 6 and we all did the all you can eat dinner for $30. Everything was great we had a great time. Jasmine was our server and she was super friendly and very attentive to our party. Ditch the overpriced strip restaurants and hit up Yama Sushi. It was a $13 taxi from the Wynn at 7:00 pm on a Saturday night.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So good

yub6_99YeJTFD8_dlYkGPA.text: This is probably my favorite ayce sushi joint in the Las Vegas area. They have the fresher slices of raw sushi and they don't overload the rice. I also like how the rice when it's warm. Other places pre make the rice and it ends up cold and hard.   Like other ayce the rolls are available for half size which is about 4 slices. The uni here was surprisingly not that fishy and the giant clam was fresh! Definitely get the sweet shrimp too! The fried shrimp head was such a great surprise!  Garlic tuna was good but don't dip it in soy sauce... there is already sauces on it and if you do then the sushi becomes way too salty.  The only negative thing was a weird smell in the restaurant... it wasn't Clorox smell but it wasn't entirely a nice smell either. I randomly smelt it while I was eating and it kind of brought the experience down.  One tip: get the red bean ice cream at the end! It was a taste I've never had before!

Pu6jD05iPyEZ_MJW01L3BA.text: This is the place to go for all you can eat. The wait is worth it. Sushi is delicious and the staff are very nice.

LnVImAzrzrADOmJSqO_84w.text: Probably one of the worst all you can eat sushi places in Vegas. The fish has this almost gelatinous rubbery chew to it and the uni has this rotten taste. The only average things they had were their ala carte options, sides, and their rolls. (Fish you should be looking out for: tuna, salmon, yellowtail, super white tuna, and uni) i haven't tried every fish their but i can say those fish were pretty poor quality.

hVpZ5BrWkilwFv2weTEUoQ.text: This is now my new sushi spot in Vegas. Excellent service even when your drunk which is always awesome waitresses have animated characters names and the food is above any casinos so I'll definitely be back.

0aLVL4c80NLUFfnO41qpkw.text: Yama sushi has always been one of my all time favs. This location is much larger and much more spacious than the one on Maryland. Service was super fast and amazing! Staff was beyond friendly. They all worked with one another to get food out quick, ask us for additional orders and constantly kept dirty plates from sitting on our table.   If I was to change one thing, it would be the interior design. It was kinda blah. Didn't have a welcoming or exciting feel to it.   Other than that service was great, staff was great, food was fresh and amazing!  Price is unbeatable! $23.95 for dinner AYCE!

P8lQ1DpWYA_bTyZYgQjz7A.text: I was shocked when I saw Yama2 only has 3 1/2 stars on yelp! This place is 5/5 in my book. I love their AYCE menu. It has appetizers galore for those who want to hang out but aren't huge fans of traditional sushi. There are plenty of nirigri options and the lunch menu really isn't that different than the dinner (highly recommend coming for lunch, so you safe a few $$). The specialty rolls are great and I love that you can order half rolls of pretty much anything! That way you can try them all and not worry about trying to finish everything.  I love the fish quality here. I've never had anything short of fresh and delicious. Their nigiri uses a little bit of rice, unlike some places that try to fill you up with cold, hard chunks of rice and charge you for it!  Service is always quick, even when they are busy. They're also very friendly whenever I come too.  Pro tip: if you want to try and space out your food but don't want to wait to order, make sure you order some nigiri and non baked items at the same time as the deep fried, or specialty things. This makes all the food come out in small batches, but you only have to order a couple of times and you don't have to try and flag down your server!   Another pro tip: try it all. You'll love it.

OgeoEhlybQP5HbpmJ4oZCQ.text: Came here for dinner one night as mom wanted to come to this place. I had always been a bit skeptical about going to this Yama since i didn't have that good of an experience at the other Yama on Flamingo.   We had came here on a Tuesday night, seated fairly quickly as soon as we arrived. We had ordered some stuff to test out the place. Tuna, White Tuna, Yellow tail, salmon, sweet shrimp, giant clam, ikura, uni, tuna poki salad, soft shell crab, agedashi tofu, hamachi kama, dynamite, salmon skin hand roll, custom handroll consisting of salmon, avocado, and ikura.   Out of the top items ordered, the best was...... the custom hand roll. Belly portion of the salmon so a fatty piece of salmon with ikura and avocado. The salmon nigiri was decent but only 2 of the 4 pieces. 2 were ok fatty, 2 were lean.   Worst? tuna poki. dont know what the heck they used in terms of sauce but it was gross. Not any kind of poke i've ever had. Seemed like a variety of sauces mixed with each other. Flavors dont meld well together. Was spicy, salty, weird bittery taste. I dont even want to think if the tuna was fresh or not.  Hamachi kama was huge but flavorless. Wasn't seared/broiled enough.   Nigiri overall, the rice was gross. Mushy.   Yellowtail had some ponzu sauce over it with green onions.   Giant clam (geoduck) is not fresh. Does not have that "crisp" feeling. Kind of mushy.   Salmon skin handroll consisted of bitsy pieces of salmon with little skin. Not crispy at all. Salmon meat way more than skin.  Should call it a cooked salmon hand roll  Not a fan of rolls to begin with so didnt order any of those. Didn't see anything that stood out that wasnt covered in sauces or weird.   The soft shell crab had a weird batter. Very different from what you'd find from other restaurants. Theirs flakes off too easily.   Service wise, it was attentive in some aspects but unattentive in other aspects. It took a while for us to get the check and dessert but they were fairly good with refilling tea and taking orders.   Overall, meh. Definitely not a fan of this place. Not for those who are interested in nigiri. Rolls and what not may be better but not my cup of tea. Not to mention the parking is horrible at most meal times here.

JVBDWEVB1hOOs6xwhO8NUw.text: We love to go to the old Yama, but due to a large party we decided to go to this one on Spring Mountain. The food was great however the seat attendant told us it would take 20 minutes before we could be seated ended up being well over an hour and a half.   After we got a table, one of the waitresses was placing a Styrofoam cup of apple juice on the table when it tore & spilled onto my daughter and niece. Just thanking God it wasn't a hot beverage. We didn't blame the waitress, but hoping the restaurant can invest in some higher quality products.   There was a bit of attitude from the waitresses while taking our orders as well. My 2 year old is a picky eater, but she loves the miso soup with the extra tofu (that's all she eats at Sushi restaurants) so I specifically asked for it. When it came out, It was evident the bowl did not have much tofu. My daughter finished it quickly and asked for more. I asked the waitress for another bowl with more tofu than the last. And she told me they're working on it and rolled her eyes.    If it wasn't for the larger space, we probably wouldn't choose this Yama restaurant over the other one.

Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cd69zjnssKzz4K-oVpp3Bw.text: I've been to the other Yama Sushi location before, and decided to come to this one (closer to my house) when my mom came to visit. Neither of us had had lunch, so we were starving and chose AYCE sushi for dinner. We came at prime dinnertime, and had to park a few streets over, but the wait was only about 15 minutes before we were seated.  Service was variable. Initially, servers were very attentive and refilled waters and took orders, but later on during our meal, we had to work a little to flag people down. Nonetheless, the service provided was fine, and you don't really get assigned a single waiter/waitress.  The menu is fairly extensive and everything is included in AYCE (except some items can only be ordered once). I like the variety of items here, between appetizers, nigiri, and rolls. The quality was decent for all you can eat, and price around $25 per person for dinner.  The interior is sleek and fairly nice, though it is not huge so it can get busy and is fairly noisy.  Overall, there are so many AYCE sushi places to choose from in town, and Yama Sushi is a solid offering.

-CbOkLqi6nsmZsO52cHF9Q.text: Yama was the total experience of being in a Japanese sushi house. As you sit upon pillows on the floor with bamboo walls and servers in kimonos pouring your rice wine. Well, you gotta truly feel like you're in Japan. I enjoy every moment here. Food and service combined were excellent. Definitely going back!!

p_tm3cu6yNspE3Chrsov2g.text: It was alright . The sushi was good but not a big variety, didn't have my favorite roll. Other than that it was good. The food was good nice environment. Clean and welcoming

bNWCA6rbn_YV2XMKcqDaUA.text: I am in shock this place doesn't have a line out the door and around the corner. The service is above and beyond quick friendly professional and spot on.  The food is excellent quality flavor and menu variety is extensive. Sexy Grandpa nametag carries a smooth flawless operation and every single person is happy here.  The place is clean good ambiance and you get seated right away. I was by myself and still got offered table or booth but chose the bar. Teletobi made sure I was never waiting for a plate.  I had plates I would have never ordered at some sushi places..as they are not exactly sushi but but since here you can choose AYCE alternative all you can eat and it is not a buffet bar...it is AYCE plate by plate freshly made. I had the greatest seafood salad y Hamachi Kama. Be adventurous and try some plates. Read what is in it ....as you should not leave food uneaten.  Common courtesy to keep the good operation of the place.  The value the experience the flavors of there were six stars  I would give it. This place at either of its two locations is a must. Spring mountain location closes 2am for late night bites while Flamingo location closes at 11pm.

0DuabGugBOXjsgMruU69eA.text: Last call is 1 hour before closing so get there before 1 to be sure. Also the bathroom smells strongly of fish... more than most other seafood places.  Otherwise, if you get in before then it's great AYCE sushi. The service is odd as the servers don't talk to another and ask you multiple times what you ordered. The food is yummy.

TYqwHZruGGEMhxP1wshFnQ.text: The sushi is fresh and if you are hungry and ready to eat then get the all you can order!! It hit the spot after a few days of dessert high winds and non-sleepless nights.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The trio

u37KSLvxDuUOSpa1JecI0g.text: I was in Vegas for a bachelor party and a friend recommended this place. The sushi is good but customer service leaves a lot to be desired. Just a note that this is all you can eat for only certain items on the menu. There are limits on the more desirable menu items. Uni, giant clam, etc.   Totally understandable except for when the waitress continues to take your order for said items and does not ever return. A bus boy ended up checking up on our order only to find out it was never put in after we patiently waited 30+ minutes. The manager apologized and explained sometimes the waitress make mistakes and take orders they shouldn't.   It happens but shouldn't our table have been notified so that we could re-order other items instead of our waitress "disappearing"? Seems like a total move to reduce the amount of food our table could order. It now makes a lot of sense why all the staff have "character" themed names and not their real ones displayed on their name tags. I will not be returning here and I do not recommend this place for an all you can eat experience.

It's got a younger crowd feel at this location and is larger than the flamingo location. There sushi is the best hands down in Vegas. When I visit Vegas this place is a must visit!!!

KDYRXiLqMhRCTYUTmFm4PA.text: I really like the location on the east side of town, but it's farther, smaller, and there's always a wait.  I was super stoked when they opened this location, so of course I wanted to go here for my birthday dinner!  The price is still reasonable, menu is the same (although some items tasted a little different), service was good, and ambience was nice!  I'd definitely come back to this location next time I'm craving AYCE sushi.

fVQ5dPfvsDDMkxnnbf99kA.text: The two times I've been here, the service was kinda.. slow. From the door (no line, but stood around a couple minutes), taking the order (~7-8 minutes), and check pick up.  We only ordered some individual rolls. The food comes really quickly tho! If you're not in a rush or anything, this place is fine.

mnYsXuwJa5zn6f1YObSSEA.text: My favorite sushi place ever! I've been a customer of theirs for several of years. Started going to the one on W Flamingo and was so happy when they opened a second location right by my house! I was kinda bummed my sushi chef didn't come to the new location but I still would drive to the old location to visit him occasionally. And then long behold, my sushi guy transferred over to the Spring Mtn location! Yay!!!! Paow is so much fun and I love how he always surprises us with his own concoctions! He makes this place that much better!  The place is always clean. The food is fresh and amazing! For the price you pay, it's definitely well worth a visit! I send my clients here when they ask for a sushi suggestion and they all thank me a billion times over and over, especially when they are fortunate enough to be entertained and served by Paow!

JUZt3YP0J1F5KSlPgJU-xw.text: Coming to Vegas for the first time, all I wanted to do was eat at an AYCE sushi place and I'm so happy I found Yama Sushi. From the second I sat down I was welcomed to a world of sushi and food I had never experienced before. Everything was just perfect from the speed of making the food to the fantastic service and then the food was unparalleled in taste. Thank you for making my dining experience so great!

7l2VMgRvHv1TFuQbKQk5mA.text: parking lot is right on Spring Mtn and is very difficult to find a parking spot during peak hours.   Came here around 1p on a Saturday. We waited maybe 5 minutes to be seated. Not packed but by time we left at 3 there was a 20 min wait.   AYCE at a good price ($20). Speciality rolls were really good. Nigiri/sashimi also good.  Fish was fresh and tasty.   Waitresses were not very friendly and service was very slow. Was there 2 hours and got a water refill once. Took 20 min to get them to come take order for more rounds. Then took us 15 minutes to get our cards taken back for pymt.   Two sushi rolls never came out and had to ask again for them.   Good food, decent price, ok location and ok service.

m7Dk2wjKx8hotkyrDc1zLA.text: Took forever to get your order and they advertise it as eat all you can, if you have all day to eat its ok. Otherwise you enjoy your first small plate next order   will be coming from california.

5RhJpCPC8sU-aHCQEhzQpw.text: Sitting is terrible, nobody to greet you when you come in, plenty of tables available and no sitting. Finally a girl came up and rudely took our name down.  Love their food but sadly the greeting and sitting is horrible.

Z6fOiZKyUhobVt7ncwiiJg.text: Host was rude but our servers Mimi and Yoon were really sweet and attentive, as well as was the rest of the staff. when i asked if i could put my name down for a table for 4, she barely looked at me and just turned the clipboard of names towards me and a pen. didn't even say hello. food  was yummy and came out quick. will come again but hopefully w a better greeting from the host next time.

QQ2nD3vV0d6obXimMx9fWQ.text: Everything came out fast. We all did the all you can eat sushi. I was wrong to order the spicy tuna roll cause it left my mouth on fire and I ended up drinking four cups of water . All in all, a great restaurant, awesome menu and besides the AYCE choice the menu had reasonable prices.  We had the Mochi ice cream for dessert, my favorite! That just topped it off.   Highly recommend going here. The waitress warmed me about the spicy tuna bring too hot but I thought I could handle it. Haha. I was very wrong. So make sure you check pepper symbols listed on the menu, it's accurate.

We were hesitant at first but the all you can eat cost less than our other option. So glad we chose here.   Everything was so good! Lots of really friendly and helpful workers.   If you do all you can eat, make sure you take a look at the rules on the menu. They aren't too restrictive but they are good to know so you don't get charged extra for wasting a roll, etc.

uHR7Q_zAhNbqtwlUPu292Q.text: Usually busy but worth the wait. The baked rolls never disappoint. Dining areas are loud enough to accommodate large groups and parties.

ThEXDqDW-QfcgT1GSYiLGg.text: AYCE $23.95  Can't go wrong with AYCE.   The poke bowl was amazing and a decent appetizer portion size.   Highly recommended Sushi restaurant and definitely a popular Vegas choice.

FUFBoQMDm3hmIffTAkMxcw.text: YAMAAAAA!!! literally my reaction anytime someone asks me where I would go for AYCE sushi, I love this place! Their original location is on flamingo right by UNLV, and if you've been there you know how long the wait is due to how small the space is. This place is located in china town and the  space is so much bigger, and it's so nice! AYCE prices are very reasonable, and they have so much to offer on their menu! Always fresh, always tasty!

84ppm22BESwy3ZoaAIQUcA.text: I came here on Sunday for a last hurrah before leaving LV and I had a wonderful experience. The service was amazing, food was great, True all you can eat with no gimmicks or catches.  I left feeling very satisfied with quality food at a reasonable price.  I wish this place existed in Los Angeles!!  I will be back next time I'm in Vegas :-)

P4AJaLUvJSY1JEw2eXLkUA.text: Yama is still the best all you can eat sushi in the West.   This is my first time at this particular location on Spring Mountain. It was open at midnight on a Tuesday and therefore we went.   The sashimi, Yama rolls and all of the other rolls that are included in the $25 can't be beat. Included was also miso soup and edename and some ice cream.   We ate until we hit the food wall. My only regret is that I couldn't eat anymore. Everything we tried was delicious. Ask for the yellowtail belly. Spicy tuna, exceptional. The Yama sauce, I wish I could buy. The sushi chefs were extremely friendly and knowledgeable and told us exactly what we should order.   Fantastic experience, can't wait to go back to Yama!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All you can eat sashimi, and everything else.

YRX0qlKXbGw6rNf27-AlmQ.text: Two things: All you can eat and sushi. I mean, c'mon? You can't go wrong with that combo. $23 plus tax for dinner and you can eat all the sushi rolls, nigiri, edamame, seaweed salad, appetizers, rice, teriyaki chicken, various other things I'm allergic to, and sadly can't try. Everything tastes and looks incredible. The service is fast, and always great. I'll sit by the bar most of the time and watch the talented chefs doing their craft. Awesome music in the place too.

__MbS1M0ilooBXA3SwFB3w.text: I've been to the Yama that's been on Flamingo and Maryland since even before it expanded and I've always been a fan. The sushi chefs are great, the food always tastes fresh, and everything in AYCE comes out in a timely manner.   This new Yama on Spring Mountain is also just as good. More spacious than the other Yama (I believe it used to be Doh sushi and tapas? I remember the set up being very similar), but with the same good sushi chefs and fish :) the menu is the same as the old one, but I felt that this one had a lot of character as far as the servers (cool names btw)! The Servers were very attentive asking if we needed anything and how things were AND they didn't rush us when ordering food. The food that we ordered came out SUPER QUICK. The appetizers actually did come first, which is  different because they normally take longer because they're fried, and then alllll the rolls and nigiri we ordered came together. (granted, we always order a lot up front because they take a while, but this place was on point).   (However, the only bad part about everything coming at once and then ordering more at different times is that things tend to get lost. My friend order 3 more items, all of which did not get to us by the time we decided to get the bill and dessert. )  I would definitely come back just based on the sushi and the service (just make sure to keep track of your orders!), and now I might always go to this location for the speed :)

soN9xob17hdu8eGi39WFjQ.text: Such an amazing change.  A total flip from yhe last time we were here on Mothers day. The venue has an amazing staff that kept things moving, clean, filled and HAPPY throughout our dine in.  Greeted and seated in record time. Our server did not skip a beat to take care of us as soon as we got seated. If you read my reviews, you know how we order when it comes to sushi. Abundance!  What ordered:  Appetizers -  Baked green mussels Fried green mussels Mix poke salad Seafood salad Salmon kama Miso soup Tofu agedashi Soft-shell crab  Negiri -  Salmon Yellowtail White tuna Uni Sweet shrimp with head Albacore Salmon roe  Sushi -  Double salmon hand roll Spicy tuna roll Ellen roll No name roll  Desert -  Green tea ice cream Mango mochi  I'm pretty sure that I'm missing more. But yes, we are now back to being regulars here. Fish to rice ratio is perfect. The baked mussels compared to Kaya is so much better. Not drowned in the cream cheese sauce and use whole mussels, not combining small ones to make it look huge. Timing on distribution was immaculate considering we order alot. As soon as a plate left, another took its place. No cluttered table, and no empty glasses. For the price point, value and quality, Yama hit the spot this night.   In addition to the food, the service was on par tonight. No wait time in between ordering what so ever. Definitely a great improvement and a nice turn around. Well earned 5 stars.

MXzpuZhlTZt20reTarPG5Q.text: This place is one of THE BEST AYCE sushi restaurants in the last Vegas area. I'm from Los Angeles, CA where there's plenty of AYCE sushi joints and there's none that can compare to this one. The closest contender is a 6 if Yama is a 10. The fish is fresh, rice on nigiri isn't excessively huge or wet like someone soaked it in seasoned vinegar for days. My best advice is to ask for all the limited order items first because those are the best. Then make your selections from the many other ayce items.  Other than the food, the service is great too and to top it off, they "service with a smile ," which is a +++ no matter if the food is bad and even better when it's good. The waitresses all have a positive customer service attitude and the supervising waitress does a really good job making sure customers are taken cared of. Additionally, unlike many ayce joints, they don't mind seating you first even if your entire party hasn't arrived.  When you're traveling with hungry kids, this is a Godsend and I didn't realize how nice that was until finally, an AYCE place will let my starving impatient kids EAT first while my NEVER ON TIME brother arrives 15 minutes later.   I hope the quality of food and service at Yama remains unchanged and at the time of writing this and for my last two visits it's been consistently Great! Though their inventory of Yellow Tail Collar goes really quick and Salmon Collar remains a deelish option, but nonetheless, ITS STILL GOOD! So I've made a pledge to myself to skip the Caesar Palace Bacchanal Buffet (think it's $80/person) and come to Yama (like $24/person) instead.  Or do both, but YAMA first!

tdR7M_zh7WfxVDSwJKHi5Q.text: Ivonne the hosttes is very sweet and helpful with the menu and customer satisfaction, it have to be a latina !!! Way to go ivonne i will comeback just to  have the pleasure to se a professional like her working again or just to say hello!!

kmXfCpsimkNdesjudtlXdA.text: This is our second time here. We like how more spacious this location is compared to their other location. The AYCE is of good value. The service is good. We look forward to coming here again.

-tFN94fZBHSPat5BMOHAWg.text: Best sushi place in vegas! Never have to wait too long, service is quick, and the sushi is BOMB

nNQlG2AojPICd1dtS_5kvA.text: Terrible customer service from the moment we stepped into the door. 3 workers were too busy taking down Christmas decorations in the front entrance to notice 4 of us had walked in. After I got their attention, they seated us to our table. Our waiter named Jack stood over us without saying a word until I asked for waters for us all to drink. When Jack returned, I proceeded to order for the table. I ordered 2 lunch specials for my aunts and a salmon teriyaki and California roll for myself. Jack just a looked at me in total confusion not understanding what I saying. I even pointed to the selection from the menu. Jack was still confused. I knew I should've asked for another waiter in the moment but tried to work with Jack. Jack kept thinking I wanted 3 orders of my selection and i was starting to become frustrated. I pointed again to the menu and said that one person wanted a soup and the other wanted a salad for their side item. Jack said ok, barely wrote anything down and went off. 10 minutes later after several other people got their food, even though we were one of the first people to walk in, I kept looking around for Jack and he was no where to be found. Five minutes later our soup and salad came out. 10 minutes after that my lunch had come. My aunts' lunches never came. I practically finished my meal and still no food. I found Jack and asked if the food was coming, and all he said was "yes" and walked away. We asked Jack again for a manager and he said the manager wasn't there. He never apologized for the wait and kept saying they are making it now. After being there for 45 minutes, the lunch finally came out and another waitress said that the slip never printed out. Probably because Jack didn't even understand what I ordered in the first place. We told another waitress we weren't interested in the food at this point and would just pay for the one order. Jack never even came back to our table. On our way out, my young child had to squeeze her way through the door way where a man was now on a ladder taking down more Christmas decorations. The was the one of the worse dining experiences I have had in China town. Beware, if Jack is your server, ask for a new person who understands English and actually understands the menu. I will not be coming back here again.

lduacuLBz_NfF_wda4kpPQ.text: Damn solid sushi and nigiri got like so many fresh salmon nigiri and dragon rolls would eat this again if I come back to vegas and craving a lot of sushi which is very unlikely but I kinda was when I came down here no regrets and would give this another go. Oh and they also had poke lol so good. Price was 23.95 a person for dinner when I went not bad if you paying for quality food but def pricy for my standards

1oKkWJ-uA6eSyUoLCe1aYQ.text: Awesome!!! Fastest service. Fully satisfied.  Best all you can eat Sushi restaurant you can find.

5Yu-UWCFpStNXzy9zWlnfQ.text: Not my first choice for AYCE SUSHI in Las Vegas It is acceptable but just so many other AYCE to compare with, I will visit again because no wait time to be seated.

They didn't even ask if we wanted to just order individual rolls or do all you can eat but just assume we were doing all you can eat. The others in our party end up waiting close to an hr for 2 rolls and at that time most of us had already finish eating.

imuHEt02Cxj6KRSrVPCyfw.text: Lol at all these salty people writing bad reviews just because their "favorite" sushi spot got taken over. How can you expect a different restaurant to serve the same type of sushi that you're used to?   Personally, I love the new look. Came here on a Saturday night and was seated 20mins later on CES weekend. Since every restaurant on Spring Mtn had a wait, we looked no further. Everything seemed promising until I was handed over a dirty menu with soy sauce stains all over it. My miso soup tasted like bleach. I had also ordered a few nigiri rolls with Quail egg at an extra charge- but it somehow came out not inside the roll. Not sure why the server didn't even apologize or offer to make me another one.   Me and my boyfriend also couldn't help but notice how every single roll going out to tables were abnormally ginormous... with too much rice. Like a ridiculous amount that I could possibly be full after 2 rolls. Wow Vegas, you like this kinda AYCE? You like to eat ALL YOU CAN EAT RICE?    Cute server uniforms, creative name badges, water and tea refilled spontaneously. Pretty wall they had installed on the right which looks like you're somewhere in the Himalayas. Other than that, will not be coming back.   If you're a visitor then you're better off somewhere else. Jjanga's, Umiya, Sushi Takashi are excellent alternatives not far from where you are.

IZj3FhP6PUYJcc0xUXHrSQ.text: Love it!  Great service, great food, decent prices.  Highly recommended!  I will defiantly come back here and will be happy and comfortable to bring friends over.

rdFEwUOQY1DBel8tXnHRmA.text: This is the second location of the legendary Yama sushi which originally started on flamingo in the corner of Maryland Parkway. It is about six times the size of the original one. I have yet to be in here when it is packed yet the staff seems to struggle to keep up with demand. The original location is far superior to this one but they still offer a great service.

Everything happened at a not busy late Sat night.  Thank you for everything on my BIRTHDAY. 1/13/2018

I loved the ahi poke, shrimp tempura, soft-shell crab...the rolls were pretty decent as well.  I don't mind going back.

zt3RMCQQiPtyialthFTI9w.text: I went to Yama last night. We were seated right away, and the overall experience was okay. The food came out in a timely fashion. The servers would forget what we asked them at times, but they came by so often that it didn't matter. Everything seemed until we got home. My friend became extremely sick later in the night. I thought nothing of it until i felt the same exact way a few hours later. I will most definitely not be coming back. I can usually give a place a second chance, but not when it has made us extremely sick.
